description: Pretty cool bar with an interesting history! Friendly clients and bartenders. Interesting cocktail mixes and knowledgeable staff. Nice place to kick back and chill.
author: Toshi P.

description: This bar is amazing. They are unjudgemental, chill, knowledgable and amazing. I grew up here and have alot of issues with "hipsters" or whatever. I feel at home here. Super glad they are keeping our freak alive. Long live service industry workers!
author: Mercy T.

description: Very cool bar located across the SF Armory.  They've got a great relaxed atmosphere.  I came when they had just opened on a Saturday so the place wasn't busy, but there were surprisingly some people there as well.  It was a nice, chill environment with a great bar and good cocktail menu.  Drink prices were pretty reasonable here with very friendly bartenders.  The place has quite a bit of space as well, it felt pretty open.  The decor was really nice, surprisingly not as provocative as I would have guessed, but still very cool.  Overall, great bar that I would definitely like to come back to.
author: Bryson L.

description:
The Armory Club is inspired by the actual armory across the street, which is currently used to film X-rated flicks. But I didn't see any sign of it trying to be sexy by associating itself with the risqué activities across the street. It's simply a nicely decorated place with a decent menu of cocktails, beer, and wine. Service is friendly and decent. 

Perhaps if you were to rent a private room here and put on a kink-themed function, then things would be a bit spicier here. Otherwise, there's really nothing to differentiate this place from any other upscale-aspiring cocktail bar anywhere in the West Bay.
author: Vincent L.

description: Left a bad taste in my mouth with the bartender who asked for more money on the tip when it was  the wrong way to approach us when he didn't read the tip right and we are regular customers
author: Lydia O.

description:
TLDR: The Armory Club venue and staff are second to none for hosting an intimate or large celebration in a private venue for a great price.

---

After researching almost every venue rental in San Francisco, I rented The Armory Club basement for my boyfriend's surprise birthday party. The rental price was $300 from 9PM-2AM for the entire basement on a Saturday night, which included a private bar/bartender, 2 gender neutral private bathrooms, a dance floor, and DJ booth (DJ not provided, I booked separately). They did not require a beverage minimum (although I'm sure my friends would've more than hit it).

The staff went out of their way to accommodate early setup to ensure the surprise, created a specialty drink to keep with the party theme, provided a fast and phenomenal bartender (Jason, who is also the owner), and met with my DJ to see what equipment would be provided/needed before the big day.

We had ~65 guests, and the space was PERFECT. Most guests were on the dance floor/at the bar while some sat at the booth tables or took pictures at the photo booth I brought (area next to the bathrooms). It never felt overly crowded, and provided a great flow.

Several guests commented on the affordability of the drinks and the phenomenal staff. It felt great to provide everyone a night that didn't break the bank and was fun for everyone.

Highly, HIGHLY recommend Armory Club for private events of any size!
author: Sarah U.

description:
Classy yet edgy bar, with great drinks and great service. It doesn't serve food, but it's well worth a visit before or after dinner. And if you're not sure where to go to dinner, just ask the bar staff--they are happy to help. 

It's a few yards from my office, so the first time my wife came to visit me at work, we popped in there--around 6 on a Thursday. The interior is spacious and elegant, like a London gentleman's club, with leather furnishings, brass fixtures, and a faux tin roof. I suppose the artwork, especially the bondage photos (Mapplethorpe?), may not be so typical, but it gives the place a local twist.

It has an enticingly exotic cocktail menu, a good wine list, and an eclectic selection of draft beers, including some from the neighboring Standard Deviant brewery. It also has a great happy hour. The creative and delicious cocktails are great value at $6 during happy hour, which appeared to still be going strong when we left well after 7. 

When we told the bartender, Sean, that we were new to the area, he gave us a list of other bars in the area to check out, and pointers on what to look for. I would hope for that from a really good hotel concierge but did not expect it from a bartender. It was good advice and we enjoyed a few of those other bars that very night. But with that kind of service, you can be sure we will be back to the Armory Club.
author: Matt A C.

description: Nice drinks, fun atmosphere, friendly and helpful bartenders. 21+ with a bouncer at the door, not for children or families with kids. Would recommend for young people in the local SF area.
author: Zoe M.

description:
Classy bar in the Mission with unique (and reasonably priced) cocktails. The bartenders are all super nice, and are happy to customize a drink to your liking, too!

There's ample seating available (including the back bar area), so plan to come here and stay for a few drinks or two.
author: Sejal D.

description:
The music is pretty good! All the space was thought perfectly. The bar and the lights are in perfect sync. The drinks are awesome! And has a broad variety of drinks. From local craft beer to strong cocktails. If you are with someone you can easily get in the mood. 

Nice place!
author: Karolina L.

description:
Great watering hole...no food. Its a sexy, super-chill place with ample space and bar, table and couch seating options. 
There's a back room with a small bar- I'm assuming for busy nights. I was there on a Wednesday- it wasn't empty but the back bar wasn't needed.
I got a gin drink from the menu. It was good but apparently not good enough that I can remember it (it was the only drink of the night so drinks didn't impede my memory)
The staff was attentive but not overly friendly. 
I highly recommend this spot
author: Michelle G.

description:
Although the theme is kink (it's owned by Kink.com across the street), it is one of the classier (and pricier) bars I have been to in the Mission. The decor is absolutely superb here. Leather seats, damask wallpaper, and some beautifully done artwork depicting bondage.

We came here around 6pm on a Saturday and it was already kind of crowded. The only suggestion I can think of is they should print out more copies of their cocktail menu. We had to wait a minute or two to get one, and I decided to wait because I really wanted to try their house cocktails. I was really happy with the drinks! I was surprised to see that their egg white drink was around $14. I usually pay $12 at other bars, but I think the drinks here are worth the price. The bartenders are competent and the atmosphere of this bar is really rich. Even though the look of this bar is victorian and modern, it still has a laidback feel to it.

The crowd here isn't what I expected. It honestly looked like a bunch of normal people. The people here actually looked more normal here than they did at the other bars I went to later that night. I had a more interesting time people-watching at Four Barrel earlier that day than I did here. It's not a negative, but I thought it was funny. Regardless, I can't wait to come back again!
author: Karen R.

description:
The Armory Club is owned by Kink in case you didn't know. It is located across the street from the Armory and it's quite a popular place in the evening. There's tons of alternative portraits inside so the faint of heart should just keep moving along. Also anyone easily offended should also not go inside. It's a very cozy space and the main bar has plenty of seating. There is also a fireplace which would be great for the colder nights. There is also a second bar down the hallway. There were only a few people in there at the time.

The bartenders make great drinks. It's a work of art watching them artfully create your drink. I highly recommend the Peace Pipe as it contains a spicy concoction of Mezcal and jalapenos. Spicaaaaay. 

Somebody broke the lock for the unisex bathroom. Don't get any ideas...
author: Tim G.

description: Affordable cocktails that's by a good dancing spot. I loved the amount of space, which makes it great for groups and to meet new people. They also have a space downstairs that you can rent for private parties. It does have an "interesting" back story, which is maybe why it's never crowded.
author: Laurisha C.

description:
Came here for a tech diversity and inclusion conference. the space is huge, well lit, and very clean!

the bathrooms are also well maintained, spacious, and accommodates many.

it looks like a castle so that's a huge plus.
author: Grace P.

description: Love this place! The bar is a well done environment that lets you relax and enjoy your cocktails. The music was a little loud but manageable if your hanging out with friends for after work drinks. The bartenders are all great and can make a great manhattan. Will be back here for the drinks, atmosphere, and staff.
author: Kyle G.

description: Been here twice now and absolutely love this place! Drinks are strong, HH prices are great and it's never too crowded.
author: Carrie L.

description:
Decided to check this place out since we had a 75+ minute wait at Shizen. Just a 2 minute walk we thought this place would be great. It's a corner bar down mission so it's not hard to miss. As for most SF places though, parking is non-existent. 

When you walk up you can see a sign for their comedy club downstairs (not sure if it's worth checking out?).  We walked in around 7:30PM the place wasn't packed at all. We were lucky and nabbed a couch and a table. A little disappointed though that we were sitting down for around 15 minutes and nobody came to clean up the empty glasses from the previous party. 

I got a moscow mule and while the service at the bar was quick, my drink was darker than usual. Not sure why though. 

Overall: Cool place with interesting artwork on the walls and decent drinks. As other Yelpers have said, service could be better.
author: Keizzel C.

description: Beautiful decor and nice atmosphere to chill and enjoy your beverages. The drinks were good as well! Overall a good experience
author: Matthew A.

description:
Conveniently located across the street from the Armory, this is a must if you're in the area (particularly if you've just finished a tour). I've come here a couple of times while I've been in town for work and this latest time, I swung by on a Saturday night to drink with some friends after doing a workshop at the Armory. 

It was crowded, but not so much that you couldn't snag a drink and find a place to stand and chat. Although we didn't have seats, we found a place near the restroom where we could set down our drinks. 

Just like everywhere in SF, there's no parking, but it's easy to find.
author: Kristel Y.

description: Cool bar, spacious, and has tasty drinks. Came here before going to a show at the armory event center across the street. It was a great spot to grab a drink & hang out. Hopefully we can come back again!
author: Nicole A.

description:
Used to be a good cocktail bar with a cocktail menu consisting of pages and pages of fucking brilliant cocktail ideas: the kind and of place where, when I was going to head to SF for the weekend, going to the Armory Club and trying some new cocktails was one of the specific things I'd look forward to. 

Now their cocktail list has exactly eleven items on it, and none is particularly unusual, let alone actually original. It fits on two small pages (say, about 5" x 7" or so, with large type and wide kerning), with a big chunk of white space on the second. But there's maybe six dozen beers on the menu, none of which you can't get any number of other places. And the first two beers I tried to order they were out of, and the bartender tried to shove a fucking Karl Strauss at me. 

Too bad. They were really good at something, and they abandoned it because they're apparently on a ceaseless quest to be more middle-of-the toad and vanilla and standard. Super disappointing, especially for a kink-themed bar. 

I guess there's no law of physics saying kinksters can't also be profoundly boring people, but I wish a bar I used to fucking love had picked a hill to die on other than proving that particular point
author: Patrick M.

description:
Great drinks good times 

Came in on a whim to kill some time and enjoyed our bar tender Tihani made it a great !
author: Azikiwee A.

description: If you're from out of town, beware. My ID was called a fake and the staff disappeared with it for 7 minutes making snide comments instead of simply asking for another form of ID. Don't bother speaking with the manager about it either. His response was to call me entitled and that his staff was merely doing their job. However there is a fine line between distinguishing out of state IDs and being blatantly disrespectful and implying a customer is a liar. As a bartender I was pretty disappointed with the service. Save your money and go elsewhere.
author: Chelsea A.

description: We had an amazing time at the Armory Club last night. Jason, the manager, helped us organize an intimate private event in the basement for our friends engagement party. The space was great, bartenders were the most friendly I've ever met in the city. They allowed us to play or own music, decorate the space, and name a few cocktails after the newly engaged couple. The drinks were fantastic and ambiance was perfect. Overall everyone at the party said they would definitely come back.
author: Akhila I.

description: This is one of my favorite bars in San Francisco it has great interior Decour and atmosphere. It has great drinks at reasonable prices for San Francisco. There are lots of unusual and interesting characters who hang out at the bar. If you're in the area I recommend stopping in.
author: Alexandra R.

description:
Look, this is probably not the bar to visit with your parents or a first date. The decor and theming leave you a little exposed to the very real possibility of awkwardness. 

That said - 

-proximity to public transit: very good. Two blocks from Bart and right outside a 14 bus stop. 

-happy hour is an amazing value and remarkably long in nature. 5-8pm weekdays, you can get craft cocktails for $7, wells for $4.50 and beer/wine for $3-4. That's nothing short of a steal. 

-have never seen them crowded on a weekday. Ample space, plenty of seating and also standing room. 

-high quality drinks. They use great ingredients and have great bartenders. 

So you have to look at some LCDs occasionally semi-nude models doing weird stuff. It's worth it!
author: Stephanie T.

description:
I went here because our company had a party here for our app, Candid. We reserved the whole backroom and it was comfortable.

If you look around, there's some paintings of kinky sex. It wasn't NSFW, it was more softcore. I don't even know why I'm writing about this but this was what I saw lol. I think it was here because the Armory across is a allegedly a place where pornography is filmed and tours are given. I can confirm this since tickets are sold on Groupon.

Anyway, our bartender was amazing! I got a couple Moscow Mules and other drinks that I don't remember, and he mixed it pretty well.
author: Aj C.

description:
When I came here I though Armory Club was associated with The Citadel but I was incorrect, it's actually owned by The SF Armory Club (aka BDSM Club).

If you couldn't tell, take a look at the portraits in the bar and you'll quickly realize what Armory is all about. BDSM aside, the ambiance is darkly lit and big enough for large groups. 

I really enjoyed my drink, 22nd Century, thought it lent more towards the sweeter side but overall good

Overall Thoughts

A bar that serves a glimpse into another world along with great drinks
author: Eddie W.

description:
We visited Thursday February 16th after a show at Public Works.

The service was terrible.

We arrive. 

Male bartender asks "What do you want?"

I ask for a cocktail menu and a glass of water.

He scoffs at me as though I just asked him to turn his genitalia inside out while playing the trombone with his butt.

He gives me a menu and hands me my water with his hand over the top of the glass, touching the rim with his fingers.

My friend and I order a couple of drinks. I ask for a half pour for myself (health reasons).

He acknowledged the order.

He then ignores my request, gives me a full pour and charges me for the full amount.

We go sit by the window to enjoy our finger tainted water and the wrong order, figuring this jaded douche would throw a hissy fit if we said anything, like "Hey, can we get actual decent service and respect here?"

I return some time later to ask for more water.

Again, he scoffs at me, acts offended, ignores me for a while, then hands me another glass, his hand completely over the rim of the glass, and says "Here you go; extra large!" with a nice "f@ck you" twist to it.

I was a server for ten years. This guy is an embarrassment to the service industry.

If your idea of a good time is dealing with a man-child's passive aggressive bullsh!t and bad attitude while enjoying grimy finger water and the drink you didn't order, then this place is perfect for you!
author: Cyrus N.

description: Great vibe here, love the lighting. Crowd seems a little more sophisticated than your average bar, but not uptight--good combo. Drink menu is really interesting, and the Winter Solstice is absolutely delicious! My favorite cocktail there for sure.
author: Lissette C.

description:
They sold us pappys 15 yr for $30 (google it and notice its $50++) but it tasted like gasoline burning down your throat. Smells great but tastes rough. We suspect it's not the real deal. Confronted the bartenders about it and they gave a cutesy answer: "it's paaaaaapular". No. It's fake and it made me loose faith in kink.com. Fake tits should not equal fake drinks. 

Bottom line, go elsewhere for the premium drinks, stay for the brand and cheaper pours!
author: Eddie L.

description:
Dropped by as part of a weekly happy hour I do with my classmates. Great place for classy drinks at a fair (if slightly high) price.

Happy hour is from 5-8PM. House cocktails are $7.50, house wine is $4.50, and draft beers are $4.00.  The cocktails are deceptively strong.

Outside of happy hour, house cocktails are ~$10, wine and beer are around $6. The featured cocktails looked really good, but they start around $13, which was a bit too steep for me. I mean, that's dinner! Dayum.

As for ambience, the place is classy as hell. The front room with the bar gets a bit more crowded and noisy, but my party of 4 was able to find a quiet niche in the back room. 

TL;DR: Good happy hour place for classy cocktails, not the cheapest, but you get good quality.
author: Abby W.

description:
I've had good times here in the past, but most recently I got screwed over buying a shot of what they called "pappy", but it was actually more or less Four Roses or Woodford that someone put into a pappy bottle. Repeat: literally someone filled the pappy bottle with lesser bourbon. I'm no expert, 
But I know mid-shelf bourbon vs top shelf.

Be wary of the $30 "pappy 15" -- In most places this would be upwards of $70 or more.
author: Will W.

description: This review is strictly for the comedy show. Came here last night and enjoyed a free night of comedy down in the dungeon of this bar. The dungeon was super cozy, filled with about 50 people ready for a night of good laughs. The stage was tiny and the comedians were standing about 3 feet away from the front row, so it's definitely an intimate experience. There's 3 rows of foldable chairs and then several booths with tables. Get there early to get the seat you want.
author: Lexi R.

description: Wednesday 6pm visit turned out really good. Not that many guests, attentive stuff. Nice location across the street from famous SF Armory .
author: Svetlana K.

description:
Cocktails with a side of kink.  The bar is dark and cozy with great victorian-ish decor.  They have a great cocktail list that changes seasonally, along with an ample selection of beer and wine.  Prices are typical SF ($12/drink).  Make sure to appreciate the artwork.

I rented the back room for an event and it was a very reasonable price - definitely a great option for a birthday.
author: Rachel R.

description:
Officially overwhelmed with the fact that these days, I won't be able to recognize more than 50% of the ingredients in a signature cocktail and will just have to trust that if I like the main liquor, I should like the drink.

I ordered the mezcal and jalapeno based drink here. It was perfectly spicy and smokey. 

I love the decor here, and the vibe, perfectly sexy. 

They also have an amazing wall of whiskys... including a few Japanese ones. When I was there, they still had a bottle of Yamazaki 18 - and a very generous pour of it was only $25. I had the pleasure of having some. Well worth every penny!
author: Cindy C.

description: The atmosphere is fantastic. If you did not know the backstory, you could end up thinking it was just a well staffed and popular bar. Then, you might take a closer look at the art ;). Patrons were attractive and interesting. Service was excellent
author: RahBurt B.

description:
Never coming back. Dishonest staff.

We were enjoying our drinks and around 1am we wanted another round. We went to the counter and heard "last call", so we thought, ok, let's order the last one. The barman was more than happy to accept our $70 for 5 drinks. It took 15minutes to make those drinks and as soon as we got them and went back to our table, we're hearing "it's closing". Why do you accept our order if you know you're gonna close that soon? Just to take our money? Really? Never coming back again. I was a pretty regular customer but you just lost one (or should I say 5). Keep up the good attitude yeah.
author: Maxime V.

description: I recently hosted a surprise birthday party for my boyfriend in the downstairs bar at The Armory Club.  The staff was friendly and helpful, and Jason in particular helped us pull things off smoothly.  Great atmosphere!  This is a bar we've liked to visit anyway, but now has added bonus as a helpful event space.
author: Christina S.

description:
A bit of swank,
A bit of kink.

Talk about your juxtaposition.

Kink's office is on one corner.
The Armory on the other.

The former is, well...
you know.
The latter is...not like that.

Actually, the Armory is quite the refined space.  Save for certain wall art, it's way more sophisticated than you might think.  

Gentlemen, get out that Hugh Hefner smoking jacket you've had in your closet just waiting for the right occasion to wear it.

This is that place.

Get yourself a stellar Armory Club cocktail, go to the back room, & let that smoking jacket shine.

Like a peacock's plume.

The drinks are first rate.  I came in w a group of my coworkers, & we were all impressed by the level of knowledge & artistry that was behind the bar.  If you're looking for perhaps a perfect cocktail in the mission, this could be the best spot for it.  Beretta, Lolinda, or right here.

I thought the staff & the crowd might be obnoxious.  Surprisingly, they weren't.  In fact, the bartender that took care of our party of 6 was downright nice.  Major props.  It was busy too.

A perfect spot for drinks when you feel like walking on the more sophisticated side.

Or wearing that smoking jacket & totally pulling it off.

4 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
If this place - or staff want to enjoy themselves without customers, I think they're doing everything they can to make it possible.
Worst bartender yelling at people on the bar, accepting late cocktails and then lying about the time he received and not letting customers enjoying them. 
I used to be a regular customer, will not come back and leave this bartender alone with his shaker.
author: Matt H.

description: Sexy ambiance, classic interior, and delicious gin cocktails made for a great pre-club stop.
author: Denise D.

description:
Sexy sexy sexy!
All the bar tenders are great, and the drinks are even better.

Anything with the Grand Poppy Amaro is guaranteed to knock your socks off!

I love the ambiance in combination with the tasty cocktails and speakeasy feel.
author: Hannah W.

description: I rented out the downstairs for my birthday party, it was one of the best nights ever!! I was able to bring in my traktor DJ gear and hook in to the sound system. Jason was an excellent host and made sure everything sounded as it should. The bartender provided fast service and was very polite. The only miss was that they ran out of pilsner... but I'd say that's mostly because my friends consume an inordinate amount of beer ;)
author: Mark M.

description:
Came here for Halloween - how could you not be a fan of this bar?

Stiff and creative drinks, awesome bartenders, SF peeps being their true crazy selves, kinky decor. 

Only thing that gets annoying towards the end of the night is waiting in a bathroom line running through the middle of the bar that has 20-25 people in it!!!
author: Yin H.

description:
Met N there. He was in a North Face jacket, pale skin, blue eyes under the dark rim glasses, a messenger bag across the shoulder, 6'2", Clark Kentish, dark brown hair, like he had just finished his dissertation at some fancy pants Ivy League, and needed a drink, and perhaps an opportunity to speak to a member of the opposite sex.  I started to laugh, with my girlfriend, and said, "Hey you want to talk to him? He beats that greasy guy by the window we had to dodge earlier." She sized him up and down and said, "Maybe." So I smiled, did one of those finger gestured thing, he moved up, all nervous, and I said, "This is my girlfriend." That was how we met. At a bar, of all places.

Turned out he was from some fancy pants Ivy League school, and he was some sort of scientist, left wing, liberal, and atheist, which to me, all good qualities men should have, and  not too far out of his PhD program, in fact. A total nerd. We talked about Walking Dead that night. I liked my zombies and he liked my girlfriend. 

I liked this bar, it's actually my favorite bar in SF, because it's neat, classy, with the right decor, excellent wine selection (GOOD French wine), and understated but prompt service. Women here are pretty, sometimes; men, not good looking at all, mostly. It has the potential to be a great bar, something you'd see in New York City, but it lacked a certain charisma. Too many young tech crowd / artist type frequenting this place, it has a younger audience than what makes a bar great. The bar itself though, is way classier than most other popular non-hotel bars.

Shortly after the new year, we came here to commiserate our shared misfortune of no one to kiss on NYE. The clock strikes twelve and we are left hanging, alone, different places. Ask why two fairly accomplished individuals with every right to be kissed on NYE and not have such luck? I know why for me, and I got no answer for him. Of course at that precise discouraging moment, the bouncer, who spoke with an Irish accent, looked at us, and said, "Happy New Year, did you guys have a good NYE?" We bursted out laughing. 

Off we went inside, and promptly ordered drinks. Perhaps not everyone will find love  on NYE, or last year, or this year, but everyone should come here and get a drink. It's delicious. A year and half later since it opened, and since my last review, it's still a gem. So here is to another good year of good alcohol. May N find himself a girl, here, or elsewhere.
author: Victoria E.

description: Great drinks, great service... but who cares, we all know why we keep coming back. Sophisticated by risque, high energy but never the least bit rowdy, this is one of my favorite bars in San Francisco and a wonderful place to have your friends meet you before you head out to a party or PW or a larger event at the Armory. Pretty nice place to spend an hour or two of your night.
author: Mike V.

description: I have to admit that this place is pretty damn dope!!! I came here for sake night and they had over 200 sakes to taste! After the sake tasting I got a personal tour from my sister and her co worker around the whole building and I love it!! A lot of great art work and a lot of DIFFERENT rooms! This place is so cool and it has that haunted feel to it (I'm sure it is haunted).  I for sure would come back for the haunted houses that they do here.
author: Christina M.

description: BDSM themed bar. Interesting set of people, always a mix  of personalities. Everytime I've been here the bar is never really packed and it's easy to get a drink. Great open and comfy seating arrangement, it a nice classy bar with done great leather couches for making out. There are two bars- one at the entrance and one in the back in addition to a downtowns area. As for the drinks, I love that they'll use raw eggs in cocktails but otherwise the cocktails are average. The bartenders are super friendly though. The music can be hit or miss, some electronic and then sometimes pop. Prices are on the more expensive side.
author: Sabrina D.

description:
I had previously gone on a tour of the Armory, but this bar was just way too crowded at the time. Luckily at 8:30pm on a Friday evening, there is a good sized crowd for a relaxing time. Cocktails here are fairly strong (around $9 to $12 each) and they have many options to choose from! A+ for that. Their craft beer and wine selection is plentiful too.

There is a downstairs space (THE DUNGEON) for events. I came here to watch their FUNgeon Comedy Show, which happens one Friday per month at 9:00pm. It's free (woohoo!) but you have a chance to donate money towards the end of the show. It gets insanely crowded, so get here as close to 9:00pm as possible. The interior design of the Armory Club is nice too, even when you think about what goes on there... anyways would totally recommend this bar and come back!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
On a recent business trip to SF, we stopped in for some pre- and post- Armory Club cocktails and Loved. Every. Bit. of the AC Happy Hour!

The cocktails were hand crafted and delicious, the happy hour prices were FANTASTIC for the city, and though we didn't try it, I was totally eyeball flirting with my bar-neighbor's lovely fruit & cheese sampler. The beauty at the rear wine bar was creating those little dairy gems, and they looked amazing!

The service was what we expected at a busy city bar- a bit aloof and impatient - so give yourself time to settle in, appreciate the erotic art that adorns the walls and enjoy the craft cocktails. 

We visited on a night where a singles mixer was being hosted, so this would be a great place to meet others too, and it's not for the shy or red-cheeked...so let the art be a spicy ice-breaker when chatting up a sexy bar patron! 

A creative menu, good people watching, tasty drinks and eye candy with a side of attitude is the perfect appetizer for the SF Armory tour. This is not your Aunt Edna's date night spot!
author: Kathe B.

description:
My friend had his birthday here and was able to rent a room for his party. He got the downstairs which was cool because it was separate from everyone else and had it's own bar and bartender. They also let you play whatever music you want and there is a bathroom you can use just for your group. There is also a decent amount of seating as well.

The bartender was really cool. She asked for what I wanted and I said something fruity, so she made me a grapefruit cocktail which was really good.

Overall, it's a really chill bar. To have a private space was really cool too.
author: Sophia Y.

description:
A bar owned by a porn company.

Imagine that.

Better yet, imagine a bar opened by a BDSM porn company.

If you're easily offended, you can stop reading now.

I don't know about you but what came to mind was tight leather clad bartenders ready to whip if you don't tip, strappados hanging from the ceiling, spanking benches for your viewing and participation pleasure, and collar-wearing patrons on all fours.

Okay, okay, so I thought Armory Club would be a Power Exchange-sque bar. Not that I've ever been to Power Exchange; for Christ sakes, I went to Catholic school.

Needless to say, Kink.com's bar, Armory Club had me intrigued. Before walking in, I said my "Our Fathers" and my "Hail Marys" and prepared myself to be ( X _ X ). To my surprise, Armory Club is unbelievably classy and sheek! The scarlet red textured walls were sensuous, the dim candle lighting was sexy, and the tasteful BDSM female bondage paintings (available for purchase) added a touch of playful naughtiness without being offensive. The spiffy dressed mixologists reminded me of a speakeasy but much swankier because of the illuminated bar area.

Lounge on one of their vintage sofas or chill in the back area (second bar) while sipping one of their strong artisanal cocktails...

One will make you warm and fuzzy. Two will make you giggly. Three will arouse you but please, NO hanky panky at this classy establishment.

Remember what they say, guys want "A lady in the streets but a freak in the sheets."

Hmm, I wonder if alleys count?

OTHER NOTES:
*Friendly and welcoming bartenders.
*STRONG cocktails. Whoo hoo!
*Cocktail Menu: http://bit.ly/Xkk79p
*Happy Hour is 5 pm to 8 pm:
--Draft beer: $4
--Well cocktails: $4.50
--House cocktails: $7 (Get the gin based "Gently Bound")
*Bar snacks available. Don't get the kettlecorn. It comes in a small 8 oz. mason jar for $6!?!?
*Back bar area is good for private parties.
*Mixed crowd but it was a cockfest the Friday night we went.
*One bathroom only. Boo! Very clean though.
*Easy street parking (same block as Public Works).
author: Cherylynn N.

description: I really shouldn't be giving the review since I don't drink.  I love this location and the atmosphere.  I will be using this place to take friends and out of town guests.  The place is great for conversation it is not creepy quiet or annoying loud which is perfect.   My friend had 2 cocktails and loved them both.  He described one as "complex" which I would take as a compliment
author: Sfclint O.

description:
Nothing says classy quite like a tastefully painted rotund lady, seated and tied in a chair with a ball gag. Yet in the stylish and put-together Armory Club, this piece of art makes sense. And in fact I love it. 

In fact there's a lot to love here, from the excellent service to the oh-so-yummy hand-crafted cocktails. I really enjoy the back bar area, seemingly out of sight from the main bar allowing for more intimate conversations or group get-togethers. There's a lot of breadth and room to the space as well, a welcome change from being crammed like a sardine in many other bars in SF.

From all appearances you would not know of the connection to the kinky porn studio right across the street, other than the well disguised decorations here and there. And that's the fun of the Armory Club...elegance with a touch of naughty.
author: Greg S.

description:
Swanky, dark interior. Lush even, and a bit kinky due to the BDSM pics on the wall. All done tastefully of course.

I never drink cocktails here although I've read that they're good. I usually just drink whiskey. Getting a drink, ordering one, waiting for one has never been an issue for me. Staff has always been super nice. Bathrooms are upstairs AND downstairs. The 2 upstairs are unisex and tend to have lines. Go downstairs! 

Props to the lesbian party last thursday in the downstairs. That 90's r&b hip hop was off the hook and had me dancing nonstop
author: Susy C.

description: Trendy bar with some excellent choices for brews. Trannys are actually kind of strangely attractive to a straight male like me . I can see later in the night the crowd is diverse as can be and cool. If your a Trump lover then I would suggest you don't come in here if you wanna live.
author: Kim H.

description: Love the happy hour here. Came here before the tour at the armory and loved the drinks so much that came back the very next day. It has beautiful ambience and the bartenders are friendly. I'd take away one star because the menu stated kettle chips as a snack and the bartender gave us a bag of chips. Could've just given us a bowl to share!
author: Ashmita V.

description: Worst venue I've ever seen. When you walk away from a show thinking about how long you waited in line to piss, you know that's an awful venue.
author: Justan F.

description:
Man - Hi there, how are you doing?
Woman- Hi, I'm good

Man - What color are my eyes?
Woman- Umm green...

Man - It's okay, *holds her hand, shaking* I'll give you a minute to recover
Woman- huh?

Man - Now that you've already had your first orgasm, would you like me to give you another?
Woman- *Smack* *throws drink in his face*

Ok, so it didn't quite go this way!! But this was the "pick-up line" that my honey gave me. I couldn't stop laughing, since he came up with it on a fly.

I ask my honey every now and then, what "pick-up line" would you use for me. He teases me and comes up with the funniest lines. Then he tells me, he would never find me in a bar, since I don't drink. He has a good point. 

His "pick-up line" would probably work in this place, since the paintings on the walls contain BDSM ladies. The décor is a modern feel with dark colors. They also have couches near the fireplace, but don't get any kinky ideas. Towards the back is the "Red Room", which I'm guessing is a private room only.

The bar area is well stocked and inviting. During happy hour the drinks are very reasonable. Definitely a place to check out before heading home for the night. 

You never know you might get lucky and meet someone, in which you can use the "pick-up line", without getting a smack on the face. *wink wink*
author: Rachel B.

description: Stopped in while waiting for Burma Love reso. Drinks are reasonably priced and tasty. Decor is interesting.
author: B A.

description:
Probably one of our favorite places in SF. Great vibe and decor. The bartenders are some of the best - we were there as tourists for the weekend and they remembered our orders the second time in. Lots of fun and lots of good memories. 

I'd check out the backroom if you can. On a good night you'll have it to yourself.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
This....was an interesting choice. I get lazy sometimes and don't scan reviews as thoroughly as I should. I was looking for a chill bar somewhere on the border of the mission with a bit of a schmancy vibe because I am high maintenance. 

So I came in expecting to have some well-crafted cocktails...which it did have. 
I expected a nicely lit, classy establishment with comfortable leather seating and a lot of mahogany...because mahogany is class, naturally. And the Armory Club flows with mahoganistic, leather-bound class. Walls with shades of gray and red envelop a great drinking environment.

What I did not expect were the slightly ... risque drinks. 
The subtle hints of well, kink. 
The not-so subtle hints of kink. 

It definitely made for some interesting conversation and I think if you come with the right people you'll be able to laugh at it and maybe if you come with the right-right people you can get a few shades of gray.
author: Jonathan Y.

description:
Me and my friends decided that after a night of dancing we wanted to hit a bar that's close. I had never been here before and was super interested because well its the armory. 

The interior design is great, absolutely beautiful.
 This being said after you've had a thorough look and drank it all in (visually).... turn around and walk out. Then head to another bar. The customer service at the armory is very cold, inhospitable. To bolster my point there were four(4) people. Already served and not needing help. The bartender seem like they hate making money. And I feel I left to big a tip for the service provided or lack of. 
The only reason they get stars is cause the decor.
author: Ari T.

description: This is a pretty cool bar across the street from the Kink factory. The cocktail I ordered (22nd century) was very reminiscent of a la Paloma. They have a few BDSM works on the walls and there's a red room in the back that I believe you can reserve for parties.
author: Katie P.

description: A classy, sexy swingin place for kinks to congregate.  Great for ppl watching, meeting like minded folks, and having a sexy drink before or after visiting the armory.
author: Chelsey G.

description:
Situation
- Friday night drinks with a couple of friends

Pros
- The interior is very nicely done
- The bartenders were attentive
- The drinks are priced fairly

Cons
- It would be nice if there were more places to set drinks
author: Dipesh G.

description:
I've been here before and I came back a second time b/c the first was awesome...

The bartender wasn't attentive and the place was half full.  Next, my drink was diluted.  

Will I come back, unlikely/
author: Angelica C.

description:
I loved "the farmer's daughter" cocktail! 

The place looks pretty classy with warm interiors and lighting. The bar tenders seemed a little overwhelmed once the people started coming in and the place started buzzing with activity; it took me a good 10-15 minutes to get their attention. I asked for the cocktail menu, and yes, the "farmer's daughter" was a cocktail that was right up my alley. I thought it was awesome for this pink-cocktail drinking manly man!

Next up, I didn't want to wait for the cocktail menu to reappear so I just asked for a "fruity cocktail that was on the sweet side". I don't know what it was but it was mighty fine! I remember "apricot" being mentioned, getting hit by the buzz halfway through the drink, and coming to the conclusion, yet again, that I am indeed a cheap drunk! Yay for the 401K!

The girl bartender knew how to pronounce my long ass full name and that made her super-awesome in my eyes! Not to mention that she was super-easy on the eyes too. Yay! 
*Hic*
author: Umesh T.

description:
Well, tie me up and tie me down, folks.  I don't know what I had actually expected (perhaps something a little more risqué or shockingly BDSM-ish???), but what I found on a Saturday night with a friend was a very well-run and classy establishment.  The cocktails were inventive and tasty.  The crowd is actually attractive and well put together.  

The bartenders are ABSOLUTELY wonderful.  My friend and I really enjoyed the vibe and the drinks.

Of course, there are portraits on the wall that are quite provocative...and you'll have to check them out, as I feel that's what lies underneath the quietly reserved exterior...

I will definitely be back because I'm curious...
author: Hiromi N.

description:
The Armory Club. It's pretty popular! I'd seen it whilst walking the mean streets of SF and had desired to infiltrate its bowels for several months. The other day, I finally had my chance.

Despite being such a popular place, the noise level wasn't terrible, and it wasn't too hard to talk to the person standing next to me. The bartender was super chill too! As an apology for waiting a long time for drinks when we first walked in, we got a couple of free drinks later that night...!

I know they're really popular for their cocktails (which everyone else in my party seemed to quite enjoy), but this message is for the beer drinkers: They have a great beer selection on tap (try the Armory XPA (Is this beer brewed for The Armory Club by Deschutes? Or does The Armory Club just choose to stock it 'cause of the name?)and the La Chouffe beer (a Belgian strong ale!), but even better is their menu! Check out what they have in bottles.

I love the decor and ambiance. I stared at the wallpaper so much that I started seeing patterns and coming up with stories from my drunken hallucinations. There's a room in the back that's got pretty comfy seats.

A warning for the weak of bladder, though! There is only one unisex restroom in the entire venue.

At any rate, The Armory Club is quite chill. Stop on by for a staple of San Francisco nightlife.
author: Jade V.

description:
I like this bar place because of its history and uniqueness that comes with the ambiance as well as its well-being in the Mission.

This bar may be offensive for some and for others, it may be entertaining.  

The decor is pretty nice - like a speakeasy vibe to it.  Drinks are reasonably priced (10 bucks more or less) and the layout is small with a downstairs' lounge as well.

Definitely a place to check out, if you haven't been!
author: Tiffany D.

description: Super fun place to hang out with some great cocktails before the mad rush of 10pm+! A few girlfriends and I stopped by here after dinner this past weekend for a cocktail and enjoyed the atmosphere prior to the onslaught of people who were kicking their night off.  I had a delicious grapefruit cocktail that proved to be a bigger bad ass than myself.  Overall, this was a great place to hang out and definitely a place I'd love to come back to for a casual drink!
author: Lisa I.

description: You can have fun here if you are with the right people to lift the mood around. The big outdoor area is a plus. Bar and food is good, music also, but the tall sits are uncomfortable after a while. Good place to spend your evening if you are looking to put some spice to the sunday.
author: Alice R.

description: Classy modern cocktail bar owned by Kink.com (located in the Armory building across the street), this place makes for a thematic stop-off following the 6pm tour of Kink.com. Check it out, either way!
author: Jake G.

description:
I visited this place with my brother for some after dinner drinks.  Little did we know it was going to be so crowded at 7pm on a weeknight.  Of course, we were both oblivious to the fact that it was currently happy hour. After finding that out that we had 1 more "happy" hour left, that certainly made us quite.....um, happy!

NOTE:  Please visit www.armoryclub.com for complete details regarding location, hours of operation, and upcoming events.  Happy Hour is Tuesday thru Friday, 5 to 8pm.

Initially after receiving our drinks ($5 well drinks), we were resorted to standing since there wasn't an empty seat at the bar, at the bar stools near the window, or in the sitting areas either.  The rear area was closed off for a private function as well, which may have contributed to the large mass of folks congregating in our immediate area.

Thankfully, the crowd thinned out past 8pm and seats readily became available.  Afterwards, I took a better look (or tried to anyway) at my surroundings.  I found that I truly liked the atmosphere and the decor of the bar.  There's a sexiness (as others have mentioned) about it honestly.

Bottom Line:  Cool bar.  Decent happy hour.
author: Michael C.

description: Mezcal cocktails galore and I hand out 5-star reviews just like that.
author: Dejana B.

description: It's ok. Not a great selection of beer. The décor is weird but the name of the place suggests that. I probably won't make a special trip just to go.
author: William H.

description: My first time giving a review.. And the armory club deserves it! Good music, nice cocktails and fantastic atmosphere!!! Also got amazed by the bdsm culture! Love sf!!!
author: Charles C.

description: Booked a table here and had a blast with my friends. Very good service and alcohol. And the atmosphere is awesome! So is the music! Definitely gonna come back again!
author: Darren H.

description: Where my debauchery night began! *happy birthday to me* A lot of fun in the Red Room and the cocktails were tasty!
author: Anne H.

description:
Even nicer.

Two years later the cocktails are still excellent, still less than $10 and the place is still run by exceptionally talented and friendly bartenders like Zachary.

Based on our visit this week you can drop in for a weeknight drink and have almost the entire intimate and alluring place to yourself. That's nice too.

What has changed is the rating. This is a five star bar.
author: Jason B.

description:
Great vibe here - dark and sexy. Sultry, even. I loved the wallpaper - an intricate repeating pattern of peacock feathers, and the ceiling - molded tin with a bronze hue. There are beautifully painted bondage scenes on the walls as well, all hung on ornate gilded frames. There's lots of seating between the leather topped barstools along the bar and windows and the lush leather armchairs and couches gathered around the fake fireplace. 

We sat on those barstools by the windows and there was a bar top there where we could put down our drinks. I loved that the edges of the wood that made up this bar top wasn't cut at straight, ninety degree angles but kept the original curvature and breaks in the wood. It gave it a very natural yet classy vibe. 

I'm always intrigued by the framed flatscreen TVs that show a live feed of the production rooms in the kink.com Armory across the intersection - of course I'll always be there after work hours, so will i ever get to see them filming anything?

They have *three* full pages of signature cocktails. This allowed my friends and I to each get something completely different that's conducive to our tastes. When we got our round and all took a sip, every one of us immediately said, "I love my drink." Of course, when we swapped and tried each other's it was a different story. But that's the beauty in the diversity of cocktail-making.

* Black Beard Punch - 4 stars
(Mount gay black marker, guava, passion, pineapple, Elizabeth all spice dram, kraken, rocks. $9)
My drink, and I love a good refreshingly sweet cocktail. It's like an amazing guava juice, and you can even taste the texture of the fruit in there - I love that part. As I progressed through the drink, I could taste the rum more and more - but it's good rum and blends smoothly into these fruit flavors. Of course, a friend who likes his strong Bourbons hated this but it was the perfect drink for me. 

* Gently Bound - 4 stars
(City of london dry gin, creme yvette, rhubarb bitters, lemon, sparkling wine. $9)
A carbonated drink that the rest of us really disliked - it tasted very strongly of maraschino cherry, almost like medicine. But hey, there's a reason we didn't order it, and our friend seemed to really like it. 

* Blushing Bee - 4 stars
(Mt casa reposado tequila, maurin quina, velvet falernum, lime, orange citrate, lavendar bitters. $12)
My bf's drink - he describes this as having herbal flavors, boozy, kind of tangy, and refreshing. I found the tequila to be quite strong in this drink, but despite that the flavors surrounding it came together well. 

Personal note: the other drink I was eyeing was the Henriette (with ginger beer and grapefruit bitters) - must try this next time!
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Sexy, Dark, Mysterious and SO my style. 

Love the 5-8pm happy hour. 

Do some research and see who opened this bar. I'm sure you can see why it's drawing so many curious like minded people.

I'm actually heading there now.
author: Lily M.

description:
Kink.com has a bar?!  ;-)

Don't worry, the owner presents a more restrained, classy environment reminiscent of the Victorian era: tin ceilings, luxe leather couches and damask wall paper. The amber lit bar is the center of attention with the smartly dressed bartenders quickly moving to get your drinks made. 

I'm a novice to this bar, so I thought I'd start with the "Gently bound", a delicious mixture of gin, creme Yvette and lemon juice topped with champagne. I was slowly sipping this cocktail when I noticed the very erotic art displayed on the walls. (read:leather + chains)  A very naughty ambiance and I'm grateful that the night was hipster free! 

If the mood feels more dark and scary, try the Zombie Princess with Appleton white rum, velvet falernum and pomegranate. The burgundy color is beautiful! 

This part of the Mission was in desperate need of a sexy drinking den like this. Excuse me while I get my kink, I mean, drink on.

Laters, baby.
author: Janice C.

description:
Came here on a rainy weekend, and liked it immediately because of the lack of line...with a decent interior and atmosphere. The bouncer was cool and chatted with us a bit before we went in, which I always like. =)

Inside...I was kinda told it would be a bit BDSM so I was prepared, but it's really not too bad. I swear, since the 50 shades crap, people have been (not so) secretly obsessed with that. Its a lifestyle people...deal with it. We're in San Francisco! I've seen worse on the bus at 7AM in the morning.

The drinks are a good price, and overall pretty good. I found nothing that I disliked. 

Service...was ok. Initially, they took forever to notice us, but I guess we weren't standing in a noticeable corner? But I always think bartenders should man the entire bar, including the corner. Sad face. After we got our first drinks though, our bartender was great at acknowledging us. She's awesome.
author: Lily W.

description:
We stopped here after the tour of the armory. Might as well go full circle by getting a drink after the tour. If you bring over your comment card, you can get happy hour specials all night. Wait until you finish the tour to head over here.

The interior is dark and the drinks are super strong. I swear even for a happy hour well drink, the bartender must've poured at least half of the vodka into my glass. I had to wait until the ice melted before drinking my vodka cranberry. My friend had to wait as well since we're both lightweights. Drinks are a bit on the pricey side if you get a special cocktail but they do put a lot of alcohol in them so you'll get your money's worth.

Since it was a Sunday night, it wasn't terribly busy. The music was good and the atmosphere seemed pretty mellow when we stopped here. It probably varies depending on the night, but I would definitely stop in here again. 

The crowd seemed pretty friendly as well.
author: Amy J.

description: The gf suggested we try this new place and I'm always up to try something different. Not on the main strip of mission, so it's a little quieter than normal. They have a main room and a smaller back room both with bars. The setup is dimly lit with comfy chairs and couches and the walls are decorated with some interesting artwork that includes LCD TV's that show the various rooms in the Armory Studio. They have a pretty good selection of drinks and several whiskey choices which is a plus in my book. They also offer 'signature' cocktails that seems to be the norm these days in bars. I don't care for it but the hipsters like it and if it makes them feel cool, then go for it. I'll stick with my whiskey....
author: Andrew S.

description:
I went into the Armory Bar after the Haunted House tour at the kink.com studio. The bar is gorgeous inside. I love the look of the decor and the selection of alcohol looked great. It's a nice space and a good crowd. 
     With that said, on the night that my friends and I went. Which was Oct. 27th after our tour, we stopped in for a drink with our drink tokens. The bar was not crazy busy but there were enough people there to have a line waiting. The issue was not waiting in the line, my issue was with the bartender. I never got her name but she was the blonde and that night had mouse ears on.  She was so rude to everyone in my party. She never smiled or said thank you. She was very short with us. When I went to let her know that we had drink tokens from the tour she sharply responded with "I can see that."  My friend found a bug in his drink and when he brought it to her attention she didn't say anything. Just grabbed his drink threw it away and made another. Another friend went to the other side of the bar and waited in line rather than deal with this rude bartender. He never got served. While waiting in line. (1 person ahead of him) the person behind my friend pushed his way up to the bar and started talking to that bartender. They seemed very friendly and had a conversation. That guy got served before my friend and the guy in front of him. 
    I won't be going back there which is too bad. I really like the space but I hate horrible customer service.
author: Mr M.

description: I am giving this two stars. I feel bad because the place is cool and the bartenders are nice but the cocktails are not very good, and are the same price as any of the high end cocktail bars. If you're looking for a bar to get a good drink and aren't into the BDSM thing I don't really recommend it unless you just want to do something weird.
author: Geoff G.

description:
I usually put more into my reviews but for now I'll just sum up my thoughts:

Pretentious, overpriced and in a way comical, if you have high expectations, you will be let down
author: Jonah H.

description:
A sophisticated and upscale bar that will let you unwind and enjoy a nice night with good friends.

Fantastic ambiance: hardwood flowers, copper tin tiles on the ceiling, beautiful dim lighting and a great crowd. It was pretty mellow around 9:30p on a Friday night, although by 11p the place was crowded and got a bit noisy. The place was still quite pleasant to be in and you still didn't really have to shout to have a conversation. The acoustics are somehow very fitting.

The staff is very professional and is able to serve you quickly, despite a possible large crowd.  There are also seating area's with, what looks to be incredible comfortable leather sofas. Those seats were taken for the while that I was there and I'm not too surprised: they looked incredibly comfortable.

Good selection of cocktails and micro-brews with an intimate and seductive atmosphere. The drinks, although expensive are strong and well-crafted. Fantastic place.
author: Alex L.

description: Great cocktails and ambience. It was a great place start off the evening before heading to our dinner reservation at commonwealth
author: Kelly S.

description: My wife has rented out the back room of this place for my birthday party two years in a row and it has been a blast. Great selection of liquor and beer, friendly staff, and classy and clean place. Jason the manager has been fantastic about making sure our group has fun and everything we need be it having the fireplace lit or specialty beers from the front bar. Highly recommend for parties or just to pop in for a drink.
author: Michael L.

description:
Like everyone has mentioned, an intimate and sexy bar that was opened by a porn company across the street.

The owner likes to expand his horizons! What can he say?!?

This intimate space has great detailed decor from the embellished ceiling to the porn bondage influenced portraits hung around the bar.  There is a fireplace on the side with a few couches, which makes the atmosphere super relaxing and comfortable to chat with friends.  You also have your bar seating and high stools along the windows.  I enjoyed my Gaw-ski with coffee bitters and eventually my red sour ale beer.  

I loved this place and better yet, it has ample of space to not feel suffocated in.  I wouldn't mind living by a bar like this to frequent!
author: Kathy D.

description:
BFF and I started our night here. Kinda wish we didn't. Plenty of parking and the location isn't that shady considering it's in the Mission.

Ordered drinks from a brunette w/ short hair. She was a b*tch. Stood in her face and was waiting to order but she steadfastly refused eye contact although she was stretching and looking around. After I raised my hand, she was like, "I saw you." Well shoot, then serve me! Not sure if this is intentional or not but she watered down our drinks. Not cool.

Tip - be sure to have a bathroom buddy guarding the door when you're using the bathroom cuz that thing will not lock even though you shove the push pin til it can't be shoved anymore.
author: Julie L.

description: The most condescending bartender I've ever come across...the bottle blonde. Will not be coming back.
author: Tim O.

description: The bartender sucks at his job and acted stressed out about the 10 customers he had. No kalua and they were out of red bull. The bar back spend more time bending over than helping me
author: Colton L.

description: Went there for a friend's birthday so had a private bar downstairs. With that said, the place felt very clean, which is my biggest thing in mission, and it was perfect for whiskey cocktails :)
author: Suprita K.

description:
Visited with hubs after the tour of the Armory itself. The bar was classy and decorated beautifully. The only giveaway that this bar is affiliated with kink (besides the name), is the tv screens that show images (no nudity that I saw) from the Armory and the kink.com sets. 
The bartenders were very nice and made what my husband called a "fantastic" martini. This is high praise from my martini snob spouse. There appeared to be a back room, but I didn't venture into it.
author: Ashleigh S.

description: Provocative loungey bar located across the SF Armory... looks exactly like you think it would inside. I know this isn't everyone's scene, but it's worth a look. Bondage-y art pieces and surveillance footage from inside the SF Armory is hung up on the walls. There are loungey couches in the main and back room, which is nice to cuddle on with your friends because you'll be waiting for your drink for quite a while! Service is slow, but it's because the bartenders are actually taking time to make good cocktails. Just be patient and soak up the scene.
author: Jennifer L.

description: While waiting for the Armory in Hell tour - stopped by for drinks. Got lucky for my party of 5 and got the booth in the back corner. Had a vodka tonic that decently made. Can't complain. Service was actually able to attend to us a couple of times during our hour there. Great decor, nice ambiance. Only one unisex bathroom?
author: Kelly G.

description:
My friend and I were scrambling for a last minute venue for a joint birthday party. Being fantastic procrastinators and self-admitted poor planners, we didn't start to make any plans until the week of. And that, we thought, would make it impossible to find any place at all.

We called the Armory club because we had heard that there was a basement room that could be rented out, so, sight unseen, we rented the space, and I'm so glad we did.

Jason is responsible for making my birthday a few extra levels of awesome than it would have been, going way, way above and beyond the call of duty.

On short notice, we were also (inexplicably) able to get DJ Purple, the best karaoke DJ in the Bay Area, to play our event. He was discussing the setup options with Jason before the party, and Jason offhandedly mentioned that they had built a stage for some special Kink events they hold there, and Purple got super excited.

Long story short - he rounded up help from the staff and we went across the street into the kinky castle, rolled the stage through porn sets, down the sidewalk, carried it down to the basement and set it up - without it, the room would have been WAY less amazing.

Jason also stayed as a bartender for us, as he couldn't find staff for the event. Super stand up move in a pinch that really made the night go off right.

We had 70+ folks in the room for karaoke, and it was hands down the best birthday party I've ever had thanks to Jason and DJ Purple :)
author: Matt H.

description:
Reasonably well-decorated, dark interiors, paired with way too much hype. 

This place is overrun with hipsters and "Lookie Losers" peeking into the world of kink, which I really shouldn't hold against it -- it's not a crime for a bar to be popular. But it does suck that, on weekends, it's a tough time finding a place to sit, let alone order a drink.

Thankfully, I met one of the managers on a gay hookup website and he provided free drinks during one of my rare visits. Having said that, this is not a place I hit up with any regularity.
author: David S.

description:
Ok. Granted I came here on a Saturday evening but still there were soooo many people that it was difficult to move in here without it feeling like a grown-up frat party. So of course when it was time to order a drink after waiting in line for like 45 minutes, I told the bartender that I wanted an AMF. He was sassy borderline rude when he snapped that they "don't do 'frat boy' drinks" and that they "only serve artisanal drinks, please refer to our menu" before taking the orders of 3 people next to me. 

That was when I decided that I could do better at a less pretentious, less fratty joint with fratboy drinks.
author: Radhika P.

description:
I love this place! There was a short line but not bad, maybe 10 mins. The bouncer was a dear, and now many bouncers can you say that about?

The cocktails are amazing! I got the Germain to Boot, which is like pink and girly but so good that all the guys got it too. Also tried something Bee, also yummy, and something with tequila that was like pure tequila wow. Think the bartender was trying to get me drunk, for my benefit or the guy buying me the drink, who knows.

I was told it's the bar for the s&m studio across the street but I didn't get the vibe beside the photos on the wall.
author: Vivian H.

description: I have been here twice now and while I love the location and decor the bartenders are extremely slow. I came in on a Thursday night and the bar was busy but not to crazy and with three bartenders I after waiting 20 mins for a drink I left. Same thing happened last October as well. The cocktail look good wish I was able to get one. After two tries a year apart I give up
author: Jerry H.

description:
This place is famous for being attached to the Armory where they film porn for Kink.com, but they really know how to run a business by associating the two just enough to create intrigue without ever crossing the line in the bar itself that could drive away customers or make people feel awkward or uncomfortable. There is nothing pornographic in the Armory Club other than a few artistic nods to Kink, a couple paintings of women in bondage and a framed tv screen that shows always empty porn sets (but you wouldn't even know what they were if you just walked in completely ignorant of Kink).

All in all the Armory Club is, i think, exactly what it sets out to be: a classy (though a little gaudy), darkly and twistedly sexy with a hint of artsy. And the pricy drinks are completely worth it. The cocktails are some of the most creative and tasty I've ever had. 

The Mission is mostly known for its dive bars, that are dingy, dirty, cramped and crowded. The Armory Club is fun, clean, fancy and spacious. The service is great, honestly they really take the time to listen to your order and get it right. I even had a guy walk me to an alternate bathroom that no one knew about and I never even asked, he just started telling people about it. No one will ever mention porn or anything like that, but you'll probably be talking about it which just ends up being a fun conversation starter.

Also check out the awesome back area if you ever get a chance, there's a smaller bar there, a couple couches and a table with a booth. Its often reserved for people, but sometimes its open to everyone. It would be cool to reserve a party back there sometime.
author: Dexter H.

description: Service is awful, there is only 1 bartender. And she was rude, people cut the line. AVOID THIS PLACE.
author: Bank S.

description:
Decent... Bar tenders kind of ignored us.. Went to close out. All fine... Got to dinner , they failed to give me my card back. Not a huge issue, but can't understand how you close someone out yet keep their card.... I didn't feel hip enough. 

Let's rock this product
author: E L.

description:
Second visit, second review, wowed for a second time. The first visit was very much of a surprise because I didnt know how much of a different type of bar this one was (speaking of the art hanging on the walls). This second time was equally amazing and again, loved the drinks.

This time we made it part of our super amazing experience of visiting the Armory and doing the night tour. Right after the tour and after being amazed by some of the art featured at the Armory studios we crossed the street and came for drinks and just hang out at the club (how convenient! you can do the tour and then just catch up with some drinks and recap your tour experience without going too far). 

Again, we had some of the fancy cocktails (fancy in name and ingredients but very affordable). On a thursday, it was very chill and not as crowded and we were able to actually sit down and enjoy our tasty cocktails. This place is all about the group of people you come with, I dont expect everyone to appreciate the art or connection of this place to the Armory across the street, but if you go with people that are open minded and can appreciate it you would have a great time (for some people some of the images can be disturbing even though they are not that intense).

This bar reminds me to bars in NYC, very red, very sexy, very lounge feeling. Indeed, this is one of the bars with the best cocktails in the entire city.
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
Opps as a kind reviewer pointed out to me, my review below is for SF ARMORY not the bar (which I've been before as well).  

I love the bar it's got an erotic sultry atmosphere, and the walls are donned with seductive art. It can be a fun date spot.
author: Jenn L.

description:
Finally dropped in, but was unhappy to not see better dressed patrons. Its sad that people do not dress for the occasion as this is a damn find cocktail lounge with top notch bartenders. 

Best: cocktails, location, bartenders, couch by the fireplace, window chairs and sultry ambiance

Not so Beast: location, Friday & Saturday nights, loose dress code
author: Jai D.

description:
Wow what an obnoxious place. If your into Flour and Water, Trick dog and the other new "Marina in the Mission" places, you may like this place. Unhelpful and uppity staff combined with a kitsch porn theme (yes I know kink.com) does not make this bar cool.

Now for the story: We came into the bar basically at last call (11:30pm on a Sunday), which can be understandably overwhelming for the bar staff. But, instead of being professionals, the bar staff and bouncer where rude and prejudicial. We where profiled most likely because we weren't "fancy" enough. Two nights before, I came after my wedding rehearsal dinner and it was a completely different experience. So I came again with my out of town friends from the wedding, what a mistake. If the employees here knew how to do their jobs, they would not let us in for a last drink and then constantly harass us to leave. KEEP IT SIMPLE and say your bar is closed, don't begrudgingly take our money and then hound us to leave. 

So I guess the lesson is to arrive at this spot well before closing hour in expensive clothes. By the way, you ruined your business for the only guy in the bar who lives and grew up in the neighborhood. THIS IS NOT A LOCALS SPOT!!
author: Zachary S.

description:
This has been one of my favorite bars since it opened, with it's fantastic cocktails, cool laid back vibe, and beautiful marble bar with great lighting.  Everyone looks good and feels cool in this bar, and it's in a great location to boot.  

That's why we decided to have our Halloween party here.  We rented the back room and basement for a private shindig and were impressed by the professionalism of the staff beforehand when planning our event, and the responsiveness during the event.  Jason and his team were extremely helpful and pushed me to create an even better party than I had planned.  We went over the cocktail menu beforehand so we could batch my selections for quick service, and renamed it to reflect the Halloween festivities.  He met us early the day of so we could decorate, and had all the equipment for any music set up, DJ included.  During the party, if anything could be tweaked (it's dancing time, can we hit the lights?) I just grabbed Jason who was working on-site and he immediately accommodated my neuroses.  ;)  

Couldn't have asked for a better bar to throw my party.  This is a great addition to the neighborhood and I highly recommend for any occasion.
author: Ashley C.

description: great bar in the mission. good drinks, quick service, upscale.
author: Joshua M.

description:
We stopped here before our tour of the armory. The place opens at 5, but door didn't open until at least 10 minutes after. The female bartender was very sweet and said it would be a few minutes while the drawers were prepared. She made sure everyone had fresh waters and in 5 minutes I had a fresh beer in my hand. 
The place is beautiful and well thought out. It is quaint and you can actually hear the person next to you. The beer selection was wonderful and included a few dark options (my fav). The only downside to this place is that they dont have any food. It would be nice to have some tapas to share as all they have now are bagged chips and peanuts. None-the-less, I will definitely be back.
author: Graciela D.

description:
I don't tend to party in the Mission anymore.  This was actually my first visit, the reviews looked good and the interior cute from the pictures posted here.  My friend and i arrived early for the get together. 
It was crowded but not bad when we arrived a little after 8pm.  The bar looked really cool i liked the lit up bar, but don't try to impress me with this, show me your vodkas! No Stoli.  hmph.    The drink list looked impressive, the names were cutesy but nothing i havent seen at bars in the East Bay.  It took a good amount of time to get a drink from the bartenders. meh.  my pet peeve. No reflection of poor service, just so many damn people! 

The crowd was eclectic, not your usual 'hipster' Mission crowd.  

Over all, it was a nice venue and I'd come back with a small group again.
author: .Vanessa G.

description:
Can kinky be classy? 

Yes, it can!

Located across the street from kink.com's fortress of porn, The Armory, the bar is classy smoking lounge meets modern cocktail bar. It is located in a part of the city where cocktail lounges are few and far between.  The space is divided between couches collected around a warm fire place to a full length bar with plenty of seats.  The kinkiest thing about this place is the art on the wall.  There are framed TV screens around the bar and the picture rotate between different sets from across the street.  I don't know if there is any live feed, but it may be a fun place to check out the next Ultimate Surrender Match Up.

The bar is clean well lit and  and a generally awesome place to hang out.  I look forward to coming back!
author: Nicole R.

description: Fun bar! I came here for a friend's surprise engagement party on a Friday, we technically weren't allowed to rent out the entire backroom but because our group was large no one else ventured to the back so we had our own space which was perfect! The vibe of the bar is fun and eclectic (think penis paintings on the wall, but classy, if that's possible haha). The drinks were all really good and the bartenders were SO friendly, it can be pretty hard to find nice, non-pretentious bartenders in the mission. I would definitely go back!
author: Lizzy U.

description:
I recently planned a birthday party for my wife and about 20 friends at Armory Club. 

Jason (manager) was professional throughout the planning process and created a great experience for our group. 

We got 2 bottles of champagne and couches near the fireplace. The venue was edgy, cool, and busy without trying too hard or being too crowded.

I'll definitely be back!
author: Eric W.

description:
Had a few drinks after supporting a friend in a wresting event across the street.

The bartenders at Armory are friendly folks. They make good drinks. The prices are on par with what you'd expect in da city. I'd drink here anytime I'm in the area. A huge plus is it's right on the muni line. No excuse to not take public transpo if you've had a few too many. 

Good place, good times.
author: W.Lawrence D.

description: Cozy sand classy. Good drinks. Only complaint is the patrons. Some major entitleness is seeping into the mission. My dear friend reserved the couches and the fireplace seats next to the main bar (which was indicated by a big enough sign). Normal people with manners would read a sign like that one and respect it. But not the idiots that we had next to our group. The blonde female scoffed the 3times I told her she had to move, her black friend told me not to worry about it, and the idiot white fella looking at his phone dissed our request for him to move. I don't understand how people can act that way. I can only imagine riffraff behaves that rude, and they all looked and acted the part.
author: Pony R.

description:
Swanky Kink with a side of vanilla. 

A lovely bar with a great back room for meetups
author: Jessica R.

description:
ZERO STAR...!
I was IGNORED by the bar staff. I stand at the bar for good 20 minutes without any welcoming look or any coaster in front of me that shows I am in, of course I left the place without having any drinks after twenty minutes. VERY SNOBBY BAR STAFF... 
I am just asking, does it take 4 minutes  to make one drink for a bar tender in the bar like Armory?
NEVER AGAIN...
author: Rahi Y.

description:
I want to go back to San Francisco to spend a whole evening at The Armory Club. It's chock full of people watching gold, plus amazing cocktails and really cool decor, including artsy bondage photos. Also, awesome bathroom that could double as a ritzy Airbnb. 

We spent 15 minutes here waiting to enter the Armory tour across the street. Great idea to have a bar across the street, since there is a lot of waiting to do for that tour if you ever go. 

It's hipster-meets-Mumford-&-Sons-meets-steampunk and maybe that all means the same thing, I don't know. There's copper and cogs and tin ceiling tiles and gorgeous wallpaper: May I have another, sir?
author: Ana R.

description:
My first thought upon walking in was "why haven't I been here before?"  I went in for a quick pre-show drink and was impressed by the awesome cocktail list and sleek speakeasy-ish decor.  Seems like it would be a great date spot.

I only had 20 minutes to spend here and can't speak to what the experience is like when the bar is packed, but I'll definitely come back to find out.

Bonus points for the guy walking around with 4505 meat samples.  Yum!
author: Sonia D.

description:
I just have to say...aside from the paintings of fleshy (or sometimes leather-clad) gagged & bound individuals, there is nothing particularly S&M about The Armory Club. Sure, it's the brainchild of Kink.Com, & I guess that fact alone make this bar intriguing & a bit taboo, but where are the bartenders in corsets? Where was the bouncer who paddles you as your "entrance fee?" Where were the sexy boys & girls with chains & whips, threatening to punish patrons mercilessly if they didn't drink fast enough? 

I wanted more kink. 

I wanted there to be more than one bathroom. (Ree-dick [note the spelling! That wasn't a typo!] in a place this size where people are imbibing to only have one bathroom.) 

And I wanted there to be more cushy, comfy couches or places to perch. 

The upside: drinks were reasonably priced & pretty strong. $9 each, I tried:
