-- zombie princess: white rum, velvet falernum (an almondy syrup), creole bitters, pomegranate, lime. Super strong alcohol taste despite the pretty pink color! So deceptive! I had to keep licking the sugared rim to cut through the taste. 
-- wake up call: bourbon, spices chocolate bitters, lime, ginger beer. I liked very much! Had a nice bite from the ginger beer. Only complaint: became watered down fairly quickly. (Now I know why other bars use one gigantic ice cube rather than many small ones.)

Another plus: the oscillating ceiling fans. 

A beautiful space on 14th & Mission, but will not be my regular watering hole.
author: Fancypants X.

description: The bar has been there over a year & I have passed the place many times but must have missed it. HH from 5-8, $4.50 well drinks that are quite stiff made by one bartender but I get you figure out which one.  :) the ambience is dark, sexy and just fits.
author: Magda G.

description:
Don't come hear hoping to hook up with a porn star from Kink.com. There, I said it. 
Do come here if you want good drinks in a sexy space while being surrounded by a welcoming crowd of eclectic folk.

Pricing is a bit weird - one time I was charged $9 for a Templeton cocktail, the next visit it was $12. I tend to think I got a deal the first time so no big deal...with cocktail in hand while chilling in front of the fireplace there are much worse ways to spend a Friday evening.
author: phil h.

description: I hardly ever get out to the city. This year (caution: useless but helpful details enclosed) for my birthday I wanted to hit the city for a change of atmosphere. Had a plan mapped out that didn't include the Armory Club, but I'm so so so so soooooo glad it just happened. Stumbled upon this place walking to a different place. Absolutely loved it. Everything about it. The staff the drinks the music the vibe and decor. Stayed the night instead of the planned bar hopping. So happy we did.
author: Melli D.

description: Swanky decor just a bit off the beaten path with cheap drinks to boot. Even their well vodka and bourbon is Russian Standard and Four Roses.
author: Thömas F.

description:
This is a great new place in the neighborhood to grab a fancy cocktail.  If you can score some of the comfy leather seats, it's a good place to have a few drinks.

Expect to find an expensive drink menu with creative and delicious concoctions, slightly surly (but knowledgeable) barstaff, and a respectable beer and liquor selection.  The artwork is kinky, but subtly and the overall decor is tasteful and dark.  

Personally, this is not the type of place I'd expect to go and meet anyone worth talking to, as there is a bit of an overdressed doucheyness to the place, especially on a Thursday-Saturday night, but it's a great place to go with people you know to enjoy a drink.
author: Meow S.

description:
Sexy. Kinky. Classy.

Internet pornography company Kink.com opened The Armory just weeks ago and managed to keep the "dirty" out and let the "sophisticated naughty" in. 

It was the perfect venue to celebrate Miss Natasha R.'s birthday. We dressed the part (knee high dominatrix style leather boots; whips, corsets, choker necklaces, etc. etc.) and rolled up early enough to catch the later end of happy hour (read discounted specialty cocktails). The Armory has a large front room and a smaller, more private back room, which houses a small one-man bar, access to the single unisex bathroom, and a private VIP couch area complete with a fireplace, which was reserved for the birthday girl's shenanigans. And the shenanigans were plenty throughout the night. 

Cocktails: I ordered the "Gently Bound" as my first drink of the evening. It was so amazing that I kept ordering them until I was too drunk to remember the name of the cocktail, so I switched to champagne. 

Friday evening here started off slow, but towards the end of the night the place was slammed and a long line formed at the entrance. The bouncers were great and easily let you back in if you wanted to get some fresh air or pump your lungs full of nicotine. 

Crowd at the beginning of the night was slightly creepy aka drunk guys in their forties that constantly walked into the back room to sneak glances at us dressed up girls, but later on in the night the vibe shifted towards a younger, hip scene.

A very fun place to grab some drinks with friends while admiring the sensuous wall art and have your night get that desired little twist of kink.
author: Anna R.

description:
The best way to end your Armory tour...with a cocktail in hand from the Armory Club!

I was supposed to go the night it pre-opened or opened its doors. Same day as Folsom Street Fair. I was appropriately dressed for the occasion and thrilled, that didn't happened due to the German beers I ended up having after Folsom Street Fair.

So, after taking the Armory tour, a few hours later, I stopped by!

Um, It's really nice to have this spot, however; I think it will soon be taken over and known as a "gay bar." No problem there, except when us, straight girls, walk into a gay bar, we often do not feel very welcome. Just a feeling I got from the crown that night. I would have for it to be a gay bar since gay, straight, and by, and trans can all enjoy this wonderful bar!

The drinks are stiff! OMG! Did you pour 80 proof into my glass?! I can't talk about the prices...as I was not paying for a single drink I was having, but I can tell you it tastes like "be prepared to pay a bit more than you'd want."

Love the spot, love the drinks, love the menu, love the crowd it attracts as well.

Two things:

1. Did you know the props people at Kink created the decor, design, and furniture for this bar?
2. Only one bathroom? The line is long, try to fix this? :(
author: Alexia R.

description:
Negative stars for the offensive price gouging ---  e.g., $17 for laphroaig 10 when the bottle is less than $40 and only pouring soda water from small bottles rather than from the bar soda gun.  The beer prices were "ok", so probably it's best to stick with that.

The interior is lovely and, if not crowded, the space/couches are great for sitting and talking.

So, after doing the math, 2 stars.
author: D E.

description:
I like this place because there are usually good looking people here and the drinks are yummy, but it is often really hot inside and I kind of take issue with waiting in line for a bar that is on 14th and Mission... its usually just not worth it.

If you are going to go... try a Thursday for a more local crowd.
author: Kate M.

description: Came here for a friend's birthday party, and gotta love Monday nights. If only every bar night was as chill as this one. Lots of space and comfy seats -- backroom for private parties, if need be, as well.
author: Mel G.

description: Dark and a bit mysterious.   The S&M photographs add an interesting element, the place across the street notwithstanding.   Terrific drinks and a stellar whisky selection.   I was pleasantly surprised with this place...
author: Max K.

description:
This is one bar I can honestly say doesn't need a room full of people to create that unique vibe that attracts people in. A quick glance around at the digital/hanging art, you're thrown into establishment filled with curiosity and excitement.  

Drinks. Drinks are amazing at around $10 a bar themed cocktail. I think mines was something on the lines of hog tie. 

Check this spot out as a prep for the tour just across the street.
author: Deon J.

description:
Highlights: 
- Chic, edgy, and swanky red decor. Reminds me ot something from 50 Shades of Gray, esp with their portraits on the walls. 
- Craft cocktails, beers on tap, wine, whiskey, you name it! 
- Unique cocktail names and really strong/crafted drinks. 
- I love the fact that there is actually seating and ample space to stand around
- The bathroom is actually lit and I can see myself. Plus! 

Improvements: 
-  I can't think of any, just don't spread my secret spot so it won't get too crowded. ;)

Tips: Come early for the best spots. There is a back room!
author: Tracy T.

description:
So, when I heard Kink was opening up a bar, I groaned. "Great," I said to myself. "The Mission will have it's very own Coyote Ugly, but with rope bondage and latex. AWESOME." I wasn't going to set foot in there until I was presenting for an event and the opening ceremony was being held at the Armory Club so I reluctantly dragged myself over there.

I have been pleasantly surprised at how fond I am of this place. It's got a really elegant feel inside that makes me feel comfortable suggesting it to a range of people, from jaded pervs like myself to bright eyed n00bs to my boss. And as a female Top type, the cute male bartenders really work for me, even if they do keep their shirts on and never dance on the bar counters. *coffhintcoff*  

There's some suggestive images on the walls, but nothing too alarming, just enough for a blush and a stammer. I appreciate that last time I was there I saw a painting of a BBW woman in bondage by one of the bars- something that really pleasantly surprised me, considering Kink doesn't work with plus sized models. Perhaps a hint of a brighter future? The drinks are also slightly risque- though I do sigh a bit at the Donkey Punch/Reverse Donkey Punch... rapey, violent drink names seem out of place in an otherwise sophisticated environment.

I did come here for Halloween, and ended up leaving with my date because I felt there wasn't a lot going on, so I guess the only thing I'd point out is that, for good or ill, don't come here expecting kinky entertainment to be going on. You may need to secretly and discreetly make your own. ;)
author: Kitty S.

description:
Cool little place.

My friends and I got here early, so we had time to snag a bunch of seats together. Happy Hour starts at 5 and ends at 8.

The drink menu is extensive. I tried the Zombie Princess: "appleton estate white rum, velvet falernum, creole bitters, pomegranate, lime". It was lovely. Sweet, yet strong. I guzzled this one down, and felt a nice buzz immediately. 

The second cocktail I tried was the Wake Up Call: "four roses bourbon, spiced chocolate bitters, lime, ginger beer". This one was tastier, but it seemed a bit on the weak side. 

I think this is one of the best looking bars I've been to. Aesthetically speaking, I love everything about it. One minor flaw: the bathroom door does not seem to lock. Having someone walk in on you while you're peeing is really creepy.

Otherwise, I think this is a perfect hangout, whether you're into kink or great drink.
author: Brandi W.

description: I just threw a large party for my sweetheart's 50th birthday at the club last night; I was so taken with the care I received, I have to write a review while the love is still flowing. I booked the downstairs room, which has a speakeasy feel to it and a private bartender. During the planning phase, Jason seemed to take care of my every wish, ease my stress and answer all my questions, no matter how trivial. The party was seamless, thanks to the staff here. Brent was our bartender for the event and he seemed to anticipate what was needed before he was even asked. A class-act all around. I'm grateful to these guys for helping me host the exact party we were hoping for. Thank you!
author: Sandi K.

description:
How quintessentially SF.

Craft cocktails, bar snacks in mason jars, and bondage-as-art.

Gently Bound. 
You or the beverage you ordered. Champagne and then some, because in the same way we don't all wake up and decide we want to drink scotch before we've tasted alcohol, you (probably) don't dive into BDSM if you don't know what it stands for.

For the rest of us, the menu and decor border on edgy, but keep it classy.
Possibly ironically, sipping a Wake-Up Call at last call, I encountered what has probably been the most polite "last call / it's time to start moving towards the door" nudging by the staff.

I look forward to many more late nights together.
author: Alissa A.

description: Love the atmosphere and ambiance at The Armory Club.  Trendy, hip, and attentive bartenders.  Ordered a whiskey sour (not on their cocktail menu) and wasn't overwhelmed by it - however, tried my friend's drinks (ordered off the cocktail menu) and they were delicious.  So, I guess I should stick to The Armory Club's signature cocktails next time.  I will definitely be back and recommend to anyone exploring the area!
author: Angela R.

description:
Went here to kill some time before heading to Nihon Whiskey Lounge.  The place was packed on a Friday night.  My friend and I waited for a bit till we got a bartender's attention.  I ordered a something "bound" (forgot the name) and my friend got a gimlet.  My friend's gimlet was pretty good while mine was just ok.  I should've gotten something else with whiskey but I was already awaiting to go to the whiskey lounge.  

The front area of this bar was waay crowded and too loud for my liking.  We walked toward the back where there was no wait at the bar and more mellow crowd...somewhere we should've been earlier.  Everything was ok..until a very drunk asian guy shouted, "hey I'm no longer the lone asian"....he then tried to continue to talk to me and my friend...at first his comment was funny and I cheers him for that but his drunkeness and slurring made my night there kinda bleh.  Overall this place is ok...it's a little too packed for my liking though.
author: Kim D.

description: im a fan of this spot!  have been here quite a few times for halloween, private parties, a casual drink.  the cocktails are really delicious here, and the atmosphere is fun.  every one is casual and looking for a great time, without any of the Marina stuffiness or pretentiousness.  lots of space too, and great conversation-provoking art on the wall!
author: Christina L.

description:
Time:  Midnight-ish.
Day:  Friday night.
Party of:  Two.
Attire (mine):  Kind of a fancy dress- I had previously attended a girl-night dinner.
First thoughts:  Hey, wait, this isn't a typical bar in the Mish (at least not the ones I've been to)... not too many too-cool-for-school-hipster-types...
Drink:  "Farmer's Daughter" which was delish.
Pluses:  Super nice door guy, very clean inside, good energy, good solid drinks.
Minuses:  I guess the art can be offensive to some, but I barely noticed it, really.
author: Sarah F.

description:
Surprised. Sexy, dark, GREAT cocktails.

Super friendly bartender in a city where sometimes bartenders aren't so friendly.  Loved the drinks. They were great spirit forward flavors. Had the traditional classics plus some fun new ones. I'd def go back. Was there on a weekday and it was quiet, not too full, but a great overall vibe for a classy drink.
author: Shanee B.

description: Fun and chic spot. Pictures on wall are very nice touch. Excellent cocktails. Bartenders friendly and professional.  Would definitely recommend!
author: Sunny C.

description: This place is totally cool. I love the decor and the interesting paintings around  . The crowd is mixed and theres no cover charge which is always a plus. Even on a Friday night , there was no line but it was very busy inside. The bartenders are very attentive, especially Chez!! Thanks CHEZ.  See you again very soon!!!
author: Claudine V.

description: I've only been once, but definitely want to come back to The Armory Club to try more of their cocktails. Super swanky atmosphere with a good drink menu. The bartenders were informative and made good suggestions to all of us. Great place to grab a drink before or after dinner!
author: Lauren C.

description: A great bar, great drinks, a great overall experience. Bartenders were friendly and the atmosphere was cool. It is located across the street from Kink, a fun good looking crowd. Would go back and suggest it to anyone who enjoys a fun laid back bar with an edge.
author: Henry J.

description: Started off fine, was kinda full but we went to order drinks. The bartender was nice. Then it all went downhill. Ended up being The shittiest service in the entire mission. Being called "motherfucker" by waitstaff was a great touch. Thanks, guys, really looking forward to coming again.
author: Daria L.

description: 10 minute wait for a drink in a not so crowded bar. Folsom crowd not even there for a reserved happy hour event. Bar staff seemed disorganized and rarely looked at customers. Plenty of staff, just no one with the oversight on the current customers. They seemed more focused on a prep for the party than attentive to the customers at had. Poor, poor service. It's too bad. I left.
author: Shelby S.

description: Located across from the famous "Sex Castle" and owned by kink.com (I think), this bar is much more of a fancy speakeasy than an erotic prelude to tours about porn. Though a little pricey, the ambiance is great and so are the seasonal drinks on rotation made by the skilled mixologists at the bar.
author: Shaina N.

description:
I reserved a space here at Armory for my boyfriend's birthday and they were amazing.  
They set up our sofas and we weren't large enough to have our own room, but they took care of us.  It's a nice, classy place and it feels nice to be there drinking a cocktail  here on a rainy day. 

After shots and several scotches later, my bf said, "Gosh, I loved that place. I would go back" :)
author: Kris O.

description: This place is a pretty cool branch off of the Armory thematically.  However, the cocktails are fairly weak.  They need to learn how to go a bit more heavy handed on the good stuff.
author: Joey S.

description: I've been to this bar a few times and am pleasantly surprised by the drinks each time. Great spot on the corner if you are heading into the Armory or to stop at before dinner. Never too crowded and they always have comfy seats. The bartenders are super helpful and friendly. The last time I went in, they were mixing new drinks and let us try one of them. They also are very knowledgeable on the rather large selection of spirits they have behind the bar and are excited to talk with you about them. Great/sexy atmosphere for a moderate price.
author: Wendy K.

description:
Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and all that is gold does not shine. Funny this is I work for Kink. Com and went over to have a night cap. It was a Sunday night with only a few people in the bar and two bartenders. 
 Now mind you I was in my grubby work cloths and not looking that sexy but I got my first drink in good time. I finish that one and was ready for another but Noooo. The two bartenders did not even give me the time of day. So I called my friend who were comeing to meet me there and told them to meet me at zeitgeist bar instead where I now I will get the attention I deserve.
author: Rodney G.

description: love this place! Great venue for a sexy casual night out
author: Patrisha B.

description: My friend had his jacket stolen here. Otherwise, great spot. Nice engaging bouncer. Cool diverse crowd in every sense of the word. Nice music and space. Cool drink menu. This place oozes sex, but in a subtle way.
author: Andrew K.

description:
What a beautiful bar!  This goes hand in hand with my old world old man's bar on the other side of the bay, the Night Light.  However, this bar is linked somehow with the Armory across the street. Dark wood everywhere, copper tin ceiling tiles; framed art that somehow screams black velvet, but are actually well crafted artistic and beautiful bdsm photos. The bar itself is a sturdy yellow toned light-box, so you don't have to worry about leaving your credit card on the bar and losing track of it.  There are several seating areas with deep leather armchair sofas.  Once you've sat yourself down with a drink, I don't think you'll want to leave.

Steve was my bartender who easily assessed my drinking needs into one of the specialties, my request for a girly cocktail, brought me the Reverse Donkey Punch, a delightful vodka based cocktail.  Girly indeed!  My second was a bourbon cocktail, with bitters and lemon tonic etc with a thick orange twist.  Now, bourbon is not my thing at all, but I wanted to check out two of the3 specialties, and I must say, it was pretty tasty despite my dislike of bourbon.  If booze isn't your think, and you don't want any part of the numerous whiskey bottles displayed boldly across the back lit shelves of bottles, well, there's an easy half dozen microbrews on tap, as well as a good variety of bottles, including a standard Miller, if that's the way you swing. While I didn't partake, there are happy hour specials.  And it's only 2 blocks from BART.

I only came by after work for a brief moment, but I will surely return soon!
author: Rebecca R.

description:
This place is cool!  I like it.

Came here on Friday around 9:30pm.  There was no line outside but inside was very busy.  

The crowd was on the mature side which was nice!  

I forgot the name of my cocktail.  It was cucumber juice with gin.  Very refreshing and tasty.

I would like to go back if I am in that neighborhood.
author: Liza T.

description: Not too shabby. Great chill spot to bring friends. DJ was not that bad either. Awkward parts...I got hit on by dudes but I suppose its because they've mistaken me for being on the team. Proud supporter but I digs the ladies buddy. I'll still go again.
author: Emmitt W.

description: Nice bar, drinks aren't too bad. Pictures ok wall are different and done tastefully. Went out on a limb while we are vacationing here but were pleasantly surprised.
author: Josey V.

description:
Thank you for 
1. Executing a classy renovation
2. Creating a welcoming and safe environment
3. Recognizing that this is a ever changing neighborhood with the need for an upscale bar
4. Employing professional and courteous people

Outstanding job, great drinks and superior renovation!!!!!! I am proud to have them as neighbors.
author: C K.

description:
Classy. Warm and inviting decor. Subtle reminders of the new ownership adorn the walls. Good drinks.

-1/2 star because it's a bit pricey
-1/2 star because Ace bar had a great kitchen; if you get hungry at the Armory Club, you better make those expensive cocktail olives last awhile
author: Eric G.

description:
Yelp has spoken. This is a sexy bar. 

We had a big group and called ahead so they'd reserve us the fireplace area. It was great to have some space to ourselves in a crowded bar, but we did have to purchase bottle service to make it happen.

The cocktails are delicious, and expensive, and the bar is crowded. But this is a pretty good addition to the neighborhood - classy, excellent cocktails and plenty of conversation starters on the walls.
author: Gretchen S.

description:
My group heard about The Armory Club from a local at another watering hole on our visit to San Fran.  

We got to The Armory at around 7:00 pm on a Friday night, just in time for the last portion of happy hour.   The bar wasn't very busy.  The back room was being reserved for a party, so we ordered at the bar and sat along in the main room along a window.

The bar was well stocked with all types of liquor (although I just looked at the bourbons and ryes for the most part) and the cocktail menu had a great mix of house concoctions.

Our party of four basically worked our way through the entire cocktail menu and all were fantastic.  I got stuck on the Smokescreen (rye, scotch, amaro, bitters) because it had the kick I like in a drink.  Sipped on the others and had no complaints.

The bartenders were awesome.  Remembering drinks, the tab, friendly, etc.

We left around 10:30 or 11 and it still wasn't jammed.

During our visit we went to a lot of establishments in SF, and without a doubt The Armory Club won the gold medal.   Well worth a visit.
author: Steven H.

description: Great bar. Ambiance was fantastic and our waitress was awesome. Drinks were good, above average, but not the best ever. Overall great experience.
author: Andrew S.

description:
This place is pretty cool. I saw a review for it in I think GQ magazine? 

Stopped by on a Wednesday evening, and the place wasn't packed at all. It was a nice chance to just walk around and chill with plenty of elbow room.

They have weird porn fetish photos and videos playing on the wall. Not as extreme as Kozy Kar, mind you, but the decor was odd enough to call attention. A semi-perfect mix of class and trash.

As for drinks, the prices were pretty fair for cocktails and from the gamut of your typical speakeasy fare. I'd likely come back if I were in the Mission.
author: Paul B.

description: After much deliberation, I have concluded that this is maybe the most beautiful bar in SF. It wasn't "founded" in 1893 or whatever, but the amber lit bar, pressed tin ceiling and plush seating options are just......beyond timeless and gorgeous. Add in attentive, friendly service and delicious cocktails.......I'll just stop there.  I love love love it here.
author: David M.

description: Went here for my first time last night. I ordered two well drinks and the bartender charged me $9 a piece. I thought it was super expensive but figured that's just the kind of bar it is. I went back an hour later and ordered one more of the same well drink from a different bartender and it was $6. Overcharging a customer by $3 per drink is a pretty shitty move and I will not go back.
author: Karissa Q.

description: stopped in before dinner at burma love during happy hour. Lots of options and great prices on belgium beer.  Cool bourbon selection and bar tender was nice enough to let us try a taste of a couple of new ones. Will return when in the area.
author: Han G.

description:
Great bar, gray staff. Diamond in the....
No problem taking my mom either.
author: Marie G.

description:
After reading a description of this place and considering its location in the Mission, I expected it to be crawling with people. So imagine my surprise when I hit up this place on a Friday night for happy hour and it was a little empty. Most of the other patrons looked like they were 30- or 40-somethings just off work. We stayed til about 10 and it didn't get much busier.

My friend got there right after it opened at 5 and she was able to claim a couch for us. Happy hour drinks were $7 compared to the usual $9. Tried the Zombie Princess and later requested a sweetened version of the Gently Bound. Both were ok, but I think my favorite was my friend's fiancee's drink: the Germaine something or other. It tasted like lychees! 

As for the decor, just imagine how a kinky Hugh Hefner would decorate a Prohibition-era speakeasy. The bartenders are cordial, but expect a wait. They take their cocktails seriously and it will take a while for them to make each drink. The bouncer was nice too. He hailed a cab for us and invited us to come back soon.

Verdict: Go here for some classy drinks with friends and know that you won't feel like you're being rushed out.
author: Teresa G.

description: This place is awesome. Bartenders are nice and informative and the prices are reasonable. Music is bumping and I wish I can hang out here all the time.
author: Mark G.

description: Great atmosphere.  Loved the drinks though I found some a but strong for my personal taste, but I'm sure others prefer. Especially liked the layout and separation of rooms. Nice sophisticated atmosphere that you don't have to yell in, yet allows for fun time.
author: Jena T.

description:
I'm a sucker for themed/stylized bars and Armory Club has got it going on.  I visited for the first time on Saturday night and was blown away by how swanky the place looked.  The ceiling alone could be stared at for hours on end, and the comfy leather chairs make me feel like I should be wearing a satin smoking jacket and discussing fine whiskeys - that's if I drank whiskey.

The drinks were a little pricey but my "dark and stormy" was really delicious and was mixed swiftly.  I hate ordering a drink that takes 15 minutes to make, I don't care how good it is.  The place was pretty full, but didn't feel super crowded.  I was also excited to see that they rent out the place for special events and have a back room for smaller private parties.
author: Margaret I.

description: Absolutely love coming here. Cocktails are always very well done and staff is great. Drink menu is very diverse.  Ambiance is awesome - just enough kink decor that you don't feel weird, just enough old school bar look that you feel like a classy classy lady.
author: Christine O.

description:
Where else can you sip on cleverly-named and delicious drinks in a place with beautiful and classy decor while casually chatting with like 20 different porn stars?

(.................................. OK, probably a bunch of places in LA, but this is about it for us up here.  And I'm happy.)
author: C W.

description: Dangerous. The drinks are tasty and strong. They do a really great happy hour. One of my favorite's. They get pretty busy on the weekends but the weeknights are just right. The atmosphere is nice. Modern decor. They have great private party space in the back room and downstairs. Bartenders are friendly and experienced.
author: Kelly C.

description: This place stinks!! They were using bleach during business hours, and it made the bar reek, especially by the bar where you order drinks!! Location was not impressive & there are some weirdos here. As well, man at the door questioned my age & ID. I was surprised to get the look from him at my age. I'm pretty sure I was much older then him. This place has potential but it needs better management.
author: Azizi A.

description: I like their cocktails which change regularly. Great happy hour 5pm-8pm, cocktails under $5. Nice people, bartenders can mix something to your taste, good selection of spirits. Gets really loud and crowded for happy hour. Sitting is awkward, good for a group not for a date.
author: Natasha S.

description: Liked the music, decor and drinks!  Relaxed atmosphere with variety of seating options, friendly bartenders and volume of music is just right.  Loud enough to hear, but low enough so that you could talk.
author: Gran A.

description: Worst drinks I've ever had from a nice place with high potential.  Terrible flavor combos and too much crappy ice. I went with 8 people and everyone hated their drinks. Sad, because the space is great.
author: Scott H.

description: It was good. I saw a guy hiding under a table going down on a girl. Witnessing that pretty much changed my view on reality. But otherwise, fantastic drinks.
author: Asher H.

description:
It's OK. Although connected with "kink.com", it's not very kinky. The decor is "bastion of male privilege". It was mostly empty in the early evening. 

No food.
author: John N.

description: What is wrong with this place? Everything. Starting with the sketch neighborhood, S&M decor...and continuing on with rude service and lack of food options (there are 2 snacks - popcorn or almonds).  We ordered the popcorn and some waitress rudely smacked down a package of popcorn. seriously, like something you would buy from a corner store. not even in a bowl? WTH? super weird and lazy. How many of these speakeasy-wannabe places does SF really need? I'll be sticking to Beretta and Bourbon & Branch. will definitely not be going back to this hipster hellhole.
author: Natasha F.

description: Great experience here! They are back!!! Love the cocktails and the service. Thanks guys. Definitely should get more Petey scotches but you really can't top your cocktail menu. Jason and BARRETT are genius
author: Kris M.

description: Great spot for a sexy happy hour. Keeping in line with the whole Armory/KINK ownership, the place has an industrial boudoir feel to it. Love the pressed tin ceiling, red velvet and peacock wallpaper. Erotic art adorns the walls and lots of luxurious-feeling leather furniture. It's a great spot for all of your boozing needs, or if you need liquid courage before a tour of the KINK facilities across the street.
author: Lee H.

description: Funny place, Interior design is one of a kind. Prices are reasonable and staff is nice :D
author: Radoslaw D.

description: Meh. This place is okay. Decent selection of beers and cocktails, but it really doesn't have much else going on.
author: Victoria G.

description: Amazing drinks and terrific staff await you at this gem in the Mission. Great place to start or end the night-whether you're feeling mellow or going all out. They also have a downstairs and back room that you can reserve for larger parties. I love the folks at The Armory Club.
author: Shalana M.

description: This place is really fun for Saturday happy hour if you come with girls.   The first time I went, everyone in the bar was socializing and I had several rounds of drinks bought for my entire group, which probably isn't normal, but it definitely made me like the place more.  I would agree with other people that customers will come up to you and ask if you're a porn star -- my bf and I both got that -- but again, free drinks so we weren't mad!   The music was pretty good and the decor is sexy.  I went another night after happy hour and it was all dudes so that is why I say bring girls with you.  Also, the drink prices are a bit ridiculous once happy hour ends so I don't think I'd go back past 8pm.  I would assume this is the right place to go if you're trying to get weird with a freaky rich dude. ;)
author: Shala M.

description: Don't bother with happy hour here. They have a poor selection of drink deals. It's the evening when this place shines. Great cocktails. Beautiful bar. sparse wood aesthetic. Fun sexy bartenders and people. You can feel relaxed about your fetish outfit and lifestyle. You though show up nicely dressed.
author: Jeff R.

description: It has got to be the only place in SF that does not have any sports or television going. It did not click in that its across the street from the kink.com until I saw the art. For a Saturday night, the service was very quick. The vibe is some combination of hipster and BDSM. The drinks are quite good. The variety is impressive and savoury.
author: Joseph B.

description: Solid place, decent drinks, lovely decor, and great for happy hours! And note, it's happy HOURS (all the way til 8pm!)
author: Suz L.

description: I came to the Armory Club with my sister this summer before seeing King Tuff show associated with OutsideLands down the block at Brick & Mortar.  When we arrived at around 9:30 or 10pm the place wasn't too busy, but that didn't stop us from enjoying a well made, stiff drink at the bar and marveling at the interior of the place.  Dim, interestingly decorated and loud enough to be lively even without a bunch of people made for a good time.  Within the hour the place had picked up a bit; we chatted with several young, sweet, smart guys and also got along with the excellent bartender quite well.  The music was good, people were incredibly friendly and the drinks were great.  Great conversation, a couple of free whiskeys and a chill group of people with good, positive vibes throughout the place made for a great pre-concert find.
author: Chloe B.

description: I think this is a cool place and the bartenders make excellent drinks, and they have La Chouffe on tap which is awesome in my book. I had a rum drink instead of beer, and it was delicious. The atmosphere is sleek and comfy with some tastefully kinky portraits on the wall which make good conversation starters. I shall return!
author: Sheila T.

description: Nice bar with stiff cocktails and an intelligent bar staff.  I had no idea it was owned by Kink.com which would explain the S&M artwork on the walls.  You would really like this place if you're into that kind of stuff.  However, if you are trying to bar hop in the mission, this place is kinda out there so it might not be ideal to make this one of your stops.
author: Alex G.

description: Nice strong drinks but expensive. They have great specialty drinks with clever names. Good premium liquor selection too. Though they may not admit it to you, I think 60% of the people I saw there work at the Armory across the street. Actually the first time I went there was with my friend who is a cameraman. He introduced me to some of his co-workers who were at the bar too. Nice atmosphere and interesting clientele.
author: Sherman B.

description: five stars for the lovely wonderful sweet ladies who run this bar!!! I had the misfortune of enjoying the atmosphere so much, I left my wallet on the bar. when I came back to get it, the bartenders exclaimed they tried to even contact me via Facebook. thanks so much, so appreciated :)
author: Anna R.

description: Great cocktails, and the best interior design in any bar in SF.  Love the back room with the flocked damask wallpaper.  Feels like home.
author: Allan G.

description: Really cool place, love the ambiance. Stopped here for pre-drinks before heading to Public Works to see QuestLove. Cocktails were yummy and it wasn't too crowded. I'd definitely come back if I'm in the area again.
author: Nikki M.

description: Had a GREAT time at my birthday party here. We rented the fireplace space, which easily accommodates 15 and at $180 including a bottle of hudson whiskey, mixers and gratuity is a pretty sweet deal. The bar manager, Kris, was especially great from start to finish  very responsive in booking and took care of us while we were there. we'll be back!
author: Erica W.

description: Can't believe it took me so long to check this place out. It exceeded my expectations. The vibe and crowd were definitely my speed. Upscale but unpretentious. Good looking crowd. Nightclub scene is not for me. This is a upscale bar great for catching up with friends or a date night.
author: L B.

description:
S.Heart and I stumbled into this place on accident. Beautiful decor inside, various seating throughout, and an inviting ambiance. This is definitely a high-end bar. The staff is well-dressed well and the bouncer is friendly and not the douchey type that thinks he's the shiz. S.Heart asked our bartender, "How long have you been open?" He replied, "about 44 minutes." Wow! We were one of the first patrons! 

I don't prefer bourbon by itself, but this particular cocktail called the Wake Up Call intrigued me - bourbon, ginger beer, chocolate bitters. It was fabulous! I love a creative, handcrafted cocktail. 

I'm excited to come back with friends. I have high hopes for the Armory Club to upkeep the fabulous feel.
author: T L.

description: A sophisticated take on the alternative scene.  Very well done with mixologists on staff.  Try the cocktails and enjoy the art on the wall!
author: Daniel O.

description: Swank as fuck. This, IMO, is the best, sexiest bar in the Mission. The decore is fantastic and the bartenders are on point. Not only are they super friendly, they're not just bartenders, they're mixologists. I don';t order drinks off the menu, I simply say..."I want something with a Hendrix and cucumber taste profile" and 5 mins later, I have a unique, one of a kind drink that's to die for. Best of all, it won't break the bank. Drinks are about $9 on average and worth every penny.
author: Johnson M.

description: Wonderful turn of the century ambience.  Henriette is a wonderful drink (although expensive).  Wondering why I haven't been here before!
author: Angela R.

description: The place looks really nice, the bartenders are friendly but the security is not. Its seems very tightly watched and its definitely a crowd. The drinks are not cheap.
author: Bantu Z.

description:
Went early on Friday to grab a drink before the show. Pretty dead for 8PM but we gave it a chance. Wait staff looked bored and didn't make us feel at home at all. Ordered a classic Whiskey Sour for way more than I would usually pay but figured hey, handmade, small batch etc. My bf ordered a martini and it was also less than stellar. Well - wasn't worth the price. 

Talked to a couple of the other people at the bar and found out they work across the street at Kink- so that was pretty cool, but they became instantly cliquish when I asked about working there and said I should just take the tour. So - overpriced drinks, crappy service and a clique crowd - I'll take my business elsewhere.
author: Joey W.

description: Really great bar.  The staff was very nice and by the end of the night the bartender has learned all our names.  It got a little too crowded as the night wore on.  It's a small bar but we will definitely go back again soon.
author: Kennedy L.

description: The Armory is a cool place to hang out and have a drink with friends. I always fing the most interesting characters when I go with friends.
author: Jessie V.

description: While associated with the kink studio across the street, the less observant may never notice the elegant paintings from it on the walls. Feels like a foyer and day room for an elegant mansion, except well, the bar and patrons. Great cocktail list and delicious drinks. Starts to get crowded later in the evening, but wasn't horrible to get a drink
author: Aki N.

description: Very well done bar with great design and an interesting crowd. The cocktails are solid and named after some of your favorite Sunday afternoon activities like "Gently Bound" and "Donkey Punch".  Coat check seemed to be a bit of a cluster you know what. They asked my friend for his ID to check a coat??  Anywho, I will return.
author: Ian K.

description: Shock alert, it's not your G rated bar! Things I didn't know when I took my date to this "cool trendy" bar. However, I will say, this club does a terrific job of providing a sexy chic environment. The only remnants of its connection with the Armory (that I could find) were the pictures on the wall. They were black and white and in my opinion, well done. The drinks were terrific (albeit a bit pricey) but the ambiance is worth a visit. It's where my (now) boyfriend and I had our first date, so I'm partial. For you gals, it's a fun place to take guys and impress.
author: Megan T.

description: Really great drinks. Great seating (grab the couch) and well-mixed crowd.
author: Sierra B.

description: I'm a fan. Great drinks and they take credit cards. Plus, it's a cool neighborhood with a nice view of the Armory.
author: Ryan S.

description: super cool place! a speak easy feel with the dark lights and cool drinks. notice the artwork on the wall though....
author: Megan F.

description: Went here on a Thursday night around 8:30-9ish to a partially filled room with mostly business types looking to grab a drink after work. I didn't try one of the house cocktails, but their bottled beer selection was outstanding, at least to my taste. I was especially surprised at how reasonable the prices were for some of these harder to find beers--I probably couldn't buy them cheaper from a liquor store. I liked the ambience and the bartenders were very friendly and down to earth. I'll definately be coming back.
author: Matt R.

description: Ok, true blood and 50 shades of gray! Ill leave it at that ;)
author: Kajal P.

description: First time here the other day and I was floored. Generous pours, lovely staff, good feel to the place. The back room was a little small for the event that it held, but that's hardly the venue's fault.
author: Dave W.

description: Nice-to-look-at bartenders - check. Great drinks - check. Sofa available before 10 - check. Fireplace - check. My new favorite to drink in the mission it is!
author: Fred F.

description: A bar built of dark wood and suitable for an Odder-Than-Thou crowd. Lots of space to stand and chat, and not too loud to do so. But, the wait time for drinks was very long.
author: Rob R.

description: The girl that has short brown or black hair and that  looks middle eastern or white is a terrible terrible bartender. And she tries to serve while her ass is sticking out and in on her fucking tip toes. I came here last night for my friends birthday and I walked in and the it was nice inside. I got there about 1050 and I got to the bar about 11 to order my drink. I was trying to get the girls  attention for 45mins and every time she would help out other people who just got there and didn't bother making eye contact with me. I was beyond mad. No one should wait that long to just get helped or asked what I wanted. We finally order and she is asking more people for drinks. She comes back and says she forgot what we wanted and we have to tell her again. Rude! We waited 45mins to get your attention and then you forget our drink order. She gave me my drink without the cucumber and it's suppose to come with it. She seemed annoyed that I went out of my way and told her I wanted them in there. The girl next to my friend had also been waiting for her drinks and he told her "hey she also wants drinks" and she had the nerve to tell him "I know how to do my job better than you do so don't worry about it" I'd agree on this if the service was great. The fact that we had to wait that long to get her attention when she was helping people who just walked up and I was in the front of the bar is ridiculous. This place is only getting 1 star because I liked the morning delight drink. To the manager, please review your staff. No one should get terrible service. To top it off she was serving the guys and not the girls. Yes I went there. She wanted to service guys and wasn't paying attention to the girls. I won't ever be coming back there again, unless they change the staff. It had potential for me to come back. But, I didn't even want to go back up for another drink. That girl ruined my night.  Btw if you are reading this. Stop sticking your ass out and don't be a bitch to customers. Sorry I'm not a guy. But as a girl I should be treated the same. BYE FELICIA
author: Ana H.

description: Super cute, classy at the same time. Great ambience;) There are two rooms and a room in the back has couch seating and a fire place! Good for dates and relaxing with friends :)
author: Hanna B.

description: A perfect stop after the Kink.com tour, or any night really.  It has a great atmosphere, and the bartenders know their stuff.  Try a not so standard Mai Tai, my friend loved hers!
author: Jay P.

description: The location is in no man's land on 14th and mission.  Its like going to Nihon Whiskey lounge.  I knew this place was going to be good when you see a pool of barf in front the door.  Nom nom.  The drinks are pretty expensive with the old fashion pricing at $14!  These guys think they are located in Beverly Hillz or the piece of fatty shiet gansevoort in NYC.  Its funny cuz section 8 housing is 2 blocks away.  I hope vivid buys the armory so some porn stars will have a drink after work.  Hopefully they will take a shower before the sit at the bar.  I don't want to get herpes from the bar stools.  I already got the "high five".
author: Fatty A.

description: A sophisticated, elegant and beautiful addition to the neighborhood. You must visit!
author: Tom S.

description: Busy or light, noisy or casual, no matter what, I can enjoy good drinks from polite and dedicated staff anytime I stroll into this bar. Security at the door means I can drink and feel extra comfy. The chairs are a plus, but my preferred spot is at the window for fresh breezes and fun people watching.
author: Aida N.

description: I gotta say I've always been interested in checking out this bar since I moved to the city. I went with a friend and loved the variety of spirits and beers on tap. The ambiance is very nice, and a bit more tame than I thought it would be, given its owners across the street. I definitely recommend checking it out and will bring more friends along.
author: Seth R.

description: We walked in just as they were opening the doors on a Saturday afternoon (5pm). The place is very chic inside, and has SMBD art nicely framed on the walls. The feng shui is off by the way in which the furniture is arranged. Too cramped and uncomfortable, it needs to be separated out more for a more inviting feel. The cocktails were unique and very tasty. We all enjoyed them. Service behind the bar was handsome, informative and helpful.
author: Greg S.

description: This place was the awesomest!  I met up with friends on my visit to SF and it was a great experience.  The bartenders are on top of their game too!  The old-fashioneds were exquisite.  The music and the ambiance were also good.  For a guaranteed good time, I would definitely come back!
author: Roxana K.

description: Losing its appeal after a few visits.  Drinks are relatively expensive compared to other spots in the neighborhood.  The beer list is not very interesting... has it changed? Or have I just become pickier?  The last few times I've come here, it's been so loud that it was impossible to have a conversation with friends -- even though the bar was not crowded at all.  Full of people with no self-awareness shouting at their friends.  Pass.
author: Heidi M.

description: Finally checked out this spot after being very intrigued for some time. The decor is beautiful , swanky and porny at the same time if you can imagine . The main room is pretty well spread out , and there is a smaller back area with a bar as well. Went on a Friday night so despite the amount of space, there was not a lot of room to sit. My friend and I ended up sitting on the stone in front of the fireplace (no joke I think I burnt my ass!). Very nice bartenders. Mixed crowd, half yuppie half Missionite . Fairly quick service
author: Lauren V.

description: Spiffy bar, nice cocktails (Frankie Says Relax, Wake Up Call).
author: Maximillian M.

description: it was a bit scary to get too but once we walked in it was a blast I love the decor of this bar it's classy and sexy so are there cocktails it was worth the trek from east bay.
author: Velonda H.

description:
Boyfriend and I were taking a long walk back from dinner to our hotel, and wanted ot grab another drink in the area. We took a seat here, completely uncrowded on a Monday night around 7, first sitting by the windows but moving to a couch near the fire after another couple left.

I can't vouch for the drink prices because I didn't pick up the check, but they had a local no-sugar-added cider, which was a huge plus for me since I can't have gluten and cider is my go to.

The interior is gorgeous, with the dark wall treatment, fireplace, gilded ceilings. We did notice the sexual (and for us, sometimes weird) art on the walls, and found out that the bar is affiliated with the porn studio across the street. We did talk to some folks from the studio, and I got the feeling that tourists didn't often come by, which is always good for feeling like you're having an authentic experience. Staff was very friendly to us though it closed about midnight since it was a Monday.

Would definitely go there again if in town!
author: Megan C.

description: oh I love this bar, especially the one in the back.  great proximity to public works to go dance if the urge strikes. strikes often.
author: Wakako U.

description: The atmosphere, the location, the drinks and the whole package rocks! One of the best bars in the city!!
author: Paolo E.

description: I likey this spot...its like where Beretta meets the Nihon Whiskey bar. That said, dont rush out the door either for awesome thin crust pizza or the widest selection of whiskey. What The Armory Club does provide is a cozy, clean environment, and if I drink much I would have commented on that too...my friends did not seem too disappointed. I on the other hand, was able to appreciate all the fine little details that the owners were keen enough to tend to.
author: Vivek N.

description: Awesome people and decor but horrible drinks.  Both of us took two sips and left the drinks.  They have pretty good alcohol but no fresh fruit.  Not sure why else the drinks were so bad.  I am comparing them to places like 15 Romolo, Maven and 83 Proof.
author: A J.

description: Enjoyable halloween night here after the Hell in the Armory tour. Bar was a little understaffed, but there was a private party downstairs and the place was packed. Drinks are nicely mixed, ambience is definitely cool, but yeah, the bathroom locks don't work too well.
author: P D.

description: A very unique little bar/lounge. The fetish themed pictures on the walls and the SF Armory across the street gives a little dark and mysterious appeal to it. The happy hour was nice and it wasn't as crowded as I imagined it would be at this time.
author: Mike P.

description: Groovy drinks, good vibe, nice, busy, not too loud. Kinda exactly what you expect and hope for in the mish. Happy hour prices are +++. Dig it.
author: Krista I.

description: Pricey but great cocktails. They know how to make a good drink with care and precision. Go here for great cocktails and good service. Can dress down but don't go too casual, its pretty nice inside. i.e., no sweatpants, you might feel out of place if you care
author: Marc M.

description: Tried to go in when it said it opens at 5, they told us it opens at 6. We went back at 6, bartender said it opens at7. As we walk out a bouncer/ employee tells us that it opens in 10 mins.  Wtf??
author: Shawn S.

description: Great new Bar on the tip of th eMission. The interior is Beuitful well built and great staff. We had a couple of drinks here waitting for traffic to die off. i will be back
author: Dan S.

description: Went here last night. I waited in line and when I got inside I was expecting to find some dark over, loud, crowded place. It was neither of those. The lighting ample enough so that I don't need my phone screen to see the menu(Rickhouse). The decor is simply awesome: classy, seductive, red, upscale and hardwood floors I think. The pictures are graphic but tasteful. The staff was cool and friendly.  Nice crowd. I had a beer so next time I'll be sure to try a mix drink or two. I'll bring my drinking partner here next time he comes down from Sac.
author: Marvin O.

description: The decor is nice with a backlit marble bar and some European palace influences.   Drinks are decently priced and well prepared.  However I was expecting more than just another touristy bar so it's hard to not be disappointed.  Was not enthused with the music either but could not find the jukebox which would explain such selections.
author: Matteo M.

description: Very cool vibe and great cocktail menu. Will return again with friends...
author: Ray T.

description: Had a great time here as a Trolley stop for my friend's bachelorette party! The space is awesome - very sexy. The BDSM theme is tastefully done and the drinks were delicious, especially the Germain to Boot. Also, had the back room reserved, and everyone commented on how gorgeous it was. Thanks to Kris for squeezing us in!
author: Coco L.

description: Love this place.  Small enough to be intimate, classy enough to impress all your friends.  Hosted a small birthday party here and the planning couldn't have gone any smoother.  Servers were on it, clearing out drinks and keeping us happy.  They didn't even bat an eye when we made everyone wear cheesy party hats.  Like that the windows give the place an open feeling even though it's a small venue instead of dark and cramped like so many other bars.  Good mix of music too, nice enough to groove to.
author: Amy S.

description: I booked the back room for a private party.  The price was reasonable, the room was just the right size for about 40 guests, and the ambiance is terrific.  Everyone who enters immediately looks at least 10% sexier.  Bar manager Kris Ramirez responded to my questions and made things go smoothly.  He permitted me to deliver some supplies (snacks and serving trays) prior to the party, and he permitted me to store stuff at the venue overnight so I didn't have to deal with it until the next day.  He arranged some hors d'oeuvres with his regular caterer, and he arranged someone to handle coat-check (she also monitored the entrance to the room to ensure that only my guests entered).  Our bartender, Mike, did a fine job.  Everyone had a great time.
author: Ben C.

description: The bartenders are great, this is no indictment on the workers, but this place is too small to reserve so many areas.  I went tonight  and not only was the back room reserved, but so were all of the couch areas.  With the back room reserved, there is only one bathroom for an overcrowded bar.  It is getting so that you really have to want to be there to be there.  Unfortunately I'm loosing my affinity for the place.
author: toby g.
